english: for use on wrapping paper, boxes, fabric
irish: lena n-úsáid ar pháipéar beartán, ar bhoscaí agus ar fhabraic

english: making posters for specific purposes
irish: póstaeir a dhéanamh le haghaidh ócáidí ar leith

english: organising a layout for a print design
irish: dearadh priontála a leagan amach

english: combining with other techniques
irish: comhcheangal a dhéanamh le teicníochtaí eile

english: composing relief print blocks, emphasising line, shape, negative shape, texture, pattern
irish: bloic phriontála rilífe a chumadh agus béim á cur ar líne, ar chruth, ar chlaonchruth, ar uigeacht, ar ghréas

english: creating interesting patterns and rhythms by juxtaposing stamps
irish: gréasa agus rithimí spéisiúla a chumadh trí stampaí a chur le hais a chéile

english: impressing found items into a slab of clay
irish: nithe coitianta a bhrú isteach i leac chré

english: making a variety of relief prints
irish: priontaí éagsúla rilífeacha a dhéanamh

english: making a variety of small-scale relief prints (stamp printing)
irish: raon de phriontaí rilífe éagsúla ar scála beag a dhéanamh (stampáil)

english: making monoprints emphasising line and shape
irish: béim a leagan ar líne agus ar chruth agus monaiphriontaí á ndéanamh

english: making stencils
irish: stionsail a dhéanamh

english: masking out some areas
irish: cuid de na hachair a mhascadh

english: spray or sponge painting over stencils cut to his/her design
irish: péint a spré nó a leathadh le spúinse ar stionsail a gearradh de réir gréasa a chum an páiste féin

english: discover how relationships develop in a scene in which the light has suddenly gone off in the haunted house
irish: an fhorbairt a thagann ar chaidreamh a fhionnachtain i radharc ina dteipeann go tobann ar an solas i dteach a bhfuil taibhsí ann

english: discover how tribal rivalries influence relationships when food is being distributed
irish: an tionchar a bhíonn ag iomaíocht idir threibheanna ar chaidreamh nuair a bhíonn bia á roinnt a fhionnachtain

english: discover what relationships develop between people when they are worried about whether their relatives will survive the storm at sea
irish: an caidreamh a fhásann idir dhaoine nuair a bhíonn imní orthu an dtiocfaidh gaolta leo slán trí stoirm ar an bhfarraige a fhionnachtain

english: from a map supplied by the teacher, decide how best to get to the house of the friendship-maker
irish: le cabhair léarscáile a chuireann an múinteoir ar fáil, a shocrú cé acu bealach ab fhearr a ghabháil go dtí teach an fhir a dhéanann cairdeas

english: in an Irish-language play, decide what to do when a farmer has gone to the Gardaí after learning that he/she, as a member of the group, is trespassing on the farmer’s land, and abide by that decision and its consequences within the drama
irish: i ndráma Gaeilge, a shocrú cad is ceart a dhéanamh, anois go bhfuil feirmeoir tar éis dul go dtí na Gardaí tar éis dó a chlos go bhfuil sé/sí, mar bhall den ghrúpa, ag foghlú ar thalamh an fheirmeora, cloí leis an gcinneadh sin agus glacadh lena iarmhairt

english: in small-group work, keep the improvisation going without repetition in order to ensure invention and creativity
irish: in obair mhionghrúpaí, tobchumadh a choinneáil ar siúl ach gan athrá, d'fhonn airgtheacht agus cruthaitheacht a chinntiú

english: when, on an upturned boat, food rations are running out, decide as a member of the group whether to eat now and hope the group is rescued or to ration the food to make it last longer
irish: nuair atá an bád iompaithe bunoscionn san fharraige agus an lón bia ag dul i ndísc, a chinneadh mar bhall den ghrúpa cé acu ab fhearr tosú ag ithe anois agus a bheith ag súil go ndéanfar an grúpa a tharrtháil nó an bia a chiondáil agus síneadh a bhaint as

english: co-operate with other members of the group in making an art representation of the kind of world the crag-people live in
irish: comhoibriú le baill eile an ghrúpa agus léiriú ealaíne á dhéanamh ar an sórt saoil a gcónaíonn muintir na gcreag ann

english: in small-group work, exchange roles so that each member of the group has a chance to contribute in the making of each character
irish: rólanna a mhalartú le chéile i mionghrúpaí oibre sa chaoi go bhfaighidh gach ball den ghrúpa deis a chion féin a thairiscint agus gach carachtar á mhúnlú

english: research the kinds of domestic and farming implements people used a thousand years ago in order to experience in drama the kind of work they might do
irish: taighde a dhéanamh ar na cineálacha uirlise tí agus feirme a d'úsáideadh daoine míle bliain ó shin chun taithí a fháil trí mheán na drámaíochta ar an gcineál oibre a d'fhéadfaidís a dhéanamh

english: as part of a drama on the making of a dolmen, show half a minute of action in which the members of the tribe endure great hardship
irish: mar chuid de dhrámaíocht faoi pháistí ag tógáil tuama ursanaigh, leírigh leathnóiméid de ghníomhaíocht ina bhfulaingíonn baill na treibhe cruatan

english: in a drama about a crime, show, as groups of detectives, an enactment of how each group thinks it happened
irish: léirigh, i ról mar ghrúpaí bleachtairí i ndráma faoi choir, mar a cheapann gach grúpa a tharla an choir

english: in a drama about life on a tropical island, show how the relationship between the girls develops when they go swimming in the sea
irish: i ndráma faoin saol in oileán teochreasach, a léiriú cé mar a fhásann an gaol caidrimh idir na cailíní nuair a théann siad ag snámh san fharraige

english: show the scene at home when the teacher’s letter arrives to say that Jenny has been misbehaving
irish: léirigh mar a bhí cúrsaí sa bhaile nuair a seachadadh litir an mhúinteora ag insint go raibh Jenny á mí-iompar féin

english: follow the leader in hauling weapons along a narrow mountain pass
irish: leantar an cinnire agus na hairm á n-iompar tríd an mbearna chaol sléibhe

english: help the other children to teach the spacewoman how to treat the flowers
irish: cabhraítear leis na páistí an spásaire a theagasc chun na bláthanna a shaothrú

english: learn and apply simple rules that give focus and meaning to dramatic activity, for example ‘do your bit,’ ‘believe it is happening to you,’ ‘listen to and accept the contributions of others’
irish: na rialacha simplí a thugann fócas agus brí do ghníomhaíocht dhrámata a shealbhú agus a chur i bhfeidhm, mar shampla 'déan do chuid', 'creid é, tá sé ag tarlú duit', 'éist le tuairimí daoine eile agus tóg ceann díobh'

english: work out from the map the meaning of the riddle that will lead him/her to where the UFO has landed
irish: ciall an tomhais a threoróidh é/í chuig an áit ar thuirling an UFO a dhéanamh amach ón léarscáil

english: bí in ann script ghearr Ghaeilge a láimhseáil agus dráma a dhéanamh di
irish: bí in ann script ghearr Ghaeilge a láimhseáil agus dráma a dhéanamh di

english: it is the turn of the hieroglyphics expert to entertain campsite colleagues by enacting the story of hieroglyphics he/she has copied
irish: is é uain an tsaineolaí iairiglifí spraoi a dhéanamh dá c(h)omhghleacaithe sa champa oibre trí scéal na n-iairiglifí a rinne sé/sí a chóipeáil a léiriú

english: learn to look on a piece of script as an invitation to create dramatic action, discovering that interpreting six lines of script, for example, can lead into many different situations
irish: a fhoghlaim gur ceart breathnú ar phíosa scripte mar chuireadh chun gníomhaíocht dhrámata a chruthú agus a fhionnachtain go bhféadfadh go leor gníomhaíochtaí difriúla eascairt as sé líne scripte

english: learn to transform script into one’s own thought processes
irish: teacht isteach ar a phróiseas machnaimh féin a dhéanamh de script

english: a greedy worker at the tomb of Tutankhamun tempts others who are busy making copies of hieroglyphics to steal what they can
irish: spreagann oibrí santach ag tuama Tutankhamun daoine atá gnóthach i mbun cóipeanna d'iairiglifí a dhéanamh chun gach is féidir leo a ghoid

english: brief a third character, who is joining the drama, with an agenda that is not known to the two who are already involved
irish: mionteagasc a thabhairt don triú carachtar atá ar tí páirt a ghlacadh sa drámaíocht agus beartas dá c(h)uid féin aige/aici nach bhfuil aon eolas ina thaobh ag an mbeirt atá gafa sa drámaíocht cheana

english: enact the scene when, in the market-place where Miolchu is buying Patrick, one of the hostages tries to escape
irish: léirigh an radharc nuair a dhéanann duine de na gialla iarracht ar éaló ó lár an mhargaidh, áit a bhfuil Miolchu ag ceannach Phádraig

english: in a drama about differences between two groups of children, increase the tension by implanting the knowledge that any person in a particular group could be a spy for the other group
irish: i ndrámaíocht faoi na difríochtaí idir dhá ghrúpa páistí, cuirtear leis an teannas trína chur i dtuiscint do chách go bhféadfadh duine ar bith i gceann de na grúpaí bheith ina spiaire ag an ngrúpa eile

english: become aware of how the need to move away increases as soon as the decision to betray a friend is made
irish: mar a mhéadaíonn ar an bhfonn imeachta a luaithe agus a chinntear ar fheall a dhéanamh ar chara a thabhairt faoi deara

english: become aware of how the protagonists in an argument, gradually moving closer to each other, can increase the expectation that they may soon come to blows
irish: a thabhairt faoi deara gur féidir le hiomaitheoirí argóna agus iad ag druidim i dtreo a chéile go dréimreach an bharúil a threisiú gur gearr go mbeidh siad i gcochall a chéile

english: imagine any object as a machine that he/she is trying to sell at the market
irish: rud éigin a shamhlú mar mheaisín a bhfuil sé/sí ag iarraidh é a dhíol ar an margadh

english: imagine PE mats as magic carpets that fly to different places
irish: na mataí corpoideachas a shamhlú mar bhrait dhraíochta ar féidir leo eitilt go críocha éagsúla

english: déan dráma ina dtarlaíonn easaontas i measc grúpa páistí ag imirt cluiche ‘hopscotch’
irish: déan dráma ina dtarlaíonn easaontas i measc grúpa páistí ag imirt cluiche 'cleas na bacóide'

english: in a drama about a family situation, experience the anger and frustration arising from a conflict over changing the television channel
irish: i ndráma faoi chor i saol teaghlaigh, an fhearg agus an frustrachas a eascraíonn as coimhlint i dtaobh athrú an chainéal teilifíse a eispéiriú

english: using the ‘mantle of the expert’, the teacher helps the children to enter into the fiction by reading a letter from Lord Caernarfon inviting them to Egypt on a dig for Tutankhamun’s tomb
irish: agus 'hata an tsaineolaí' á chaitheamh aige/aici, cabhraíonn an múinteoir leis na páistí páirt a ghlacadh san fhicsean trí litir ón Tiarna Caernarfon a léamh dóibh, litir ina dtugtar cuireadh dóibh teacht ar fheachtas chun na hÉigipte chun tuama Tutankham

english: while accepting a commitment to the fictional consequences, take on the task of creating a welcome for members of a rival tribe whose help is needed in building a dolmen
irish: i gcomhthéacs ina bhfuiltear sásta glacadh lena n-iarmhairtí ficseanacha, tabhairt faoi fháiltiú a bheartú le haghaidh ball treibhe lena bhfuil siad in iomaíocht ach a bhfuil a gcabhair ag teastáil chun tuama ursanach a thógáil

english: Aengus knows that Patrick is holy and doesn’t want to disturb his prayers, but when Patrick stakes Aengus’ foot by mistake enact what happens next
irish: tá a fhios ag Aonghas go bhfuil Pádraig naofa agus ní maith leis cur isteach ar a phaidreacha; léirigh an méid a tharlaíonn nuair a shánn Pádraig cos Aonghasa de thaisme

english: knowing that the tide is coming in fast and that some of the children can’t swim, decide whether to try and wade to safety or spend the night on the island
irish: agus é ar eolas go bhfuil an taoide ag tuilleadh go tapaidh agus nach bhfuil snámh ag cuid de na páistí, a chinneadh cé acu ab fhearr iarracht a dhéanamh ar lapadaíl go háit slán nó an oíche a chaitheamh ar an oileán

english: the members of the tribe, having had the experience of trying to move the stone and desiring to go home to help their starving kinsmen, decide whether to bring the stone home or let it sink into the bog
irish: tar éis taithí ar bheith ag iarraidh an chloch a bhogadh agus fonn a bheith anois orthu filleadh ar an mbaile chun teacht i gcabhair ar a muintir, atá stiúgtha ag an ocras, ní mór do bhaill na treibhe a chinneadh cé acu an dtabharfaidh siad an chloch leo

english: the parents, knowing that a child has fallen into the lake, decide to find out how it happened
irish: agus a fhios acu gur thit an páiste isteach sa loch, cinneann na tuismitheoirí ar a fháil amach cé mar a tharla an timpiste

english: a whale has landed on the shore: encourage the children to become certain people with attitudes to the whale (other than the children’s own)
irish: tá míol mór tar éis teacht i dtír ar an trá: spreagtar na páistí chun a ligean orthu féin gur daoine áirithe iad a bhfuil dearcadh faoi leith acu i leith an mhíl mhóir (dearcadh nach ionann le dearcadh na bpáistí féin)

english: in a boat scene a group member is briefed to show, in role, how reflective (St.) Patrick is, compared with the other hostages
irish: i radharc ar bord loinge cuirtear mionteagasc ar bhall amháin den ghrúpa a léiriú chomh smaointeach is atá (Naomh) Pádraig i gcomparáid leis na gialla eile

english: in role as members of a tribe, the children decide to build a dolmen, but as their characters develop through the drama they decide to abandon the project
irish: ina rólanna mar bhaill treibhe, cinneann na páistí ar thuama ursanach a thógáil, ach de réir mar a thagann forbairt ar a gcarachtair i gcaitheamh na drámaíochta cinneann siad ar éirí as an tionscadal

english: the Children of Lir meet a group of people who have diverse attitudes to swans
irish: castar Clann Lir ar ghrúpa daoine a bhfuil tuairimí éagsúla acu i leith ealaí

english: if one were to make a soap-opera about the school, enact with others a small group scene that would best encapsulate the school
irish: dá mbeadh ar dhuine sraithscéal a dhéanamh i dtaobh na scoile, an radharc is fearr a thabharfadh léargas ar an scoil a léiriú mar radharc ghrúpa i dteanntale páistí eile

english: small groups depict people’s reactions at moments of great change in history
irish: léiríonn grúpaí beaga freagairt daoine ag ócáidí mórathruithe sa stair

english: through a drama about a child whose parents never let him/her do what he/she wants to do, explore and ask questions about freedom and responsibility
irish: trí mheán dráma i dtaobh páiste nach gceadaíonn a t(h)uismitheoirí dó/di choíche a rogha rud a dhéanamh, ceisteanna i dtaobh saoirse agus freagrachta a chur agus a iniúchadh

english: decide whether the drama is exciting enough and what could be done to make it more exciting
irish: cinneadh an bhfuil an drámaíocht sách spreagúil agus machnamh ar a bhféadfaí a dhéanamh chun é a dhéanamh níos spreagúla fós

english: he/she wonders if a parent would treat his/her child in this way and what direction the drama could take if he/she were kinder
irish: fiafraíonn sé/sí de/di féin an mar seo a chaithfeadh tuismitheoir lena p(h)áiste agus cén chríoch a d'fhéadfadh bheith ar an drámaíocht dá mbeadh sé/sí féin níos cineálta

english: in a drama about friendship, the cowboy wonders if he should have told the sheriff what he had seen his friend do
irish: i ndrámaíocht faoi chairdeas fiafraíonn an buachaill bó de féin ar chóir dó a insint don sirriam cad a chonaic sé á dhéanamh ag a chara

english: discuss one child’s opinion that the drama is silly, because if the gang had behaved like that they would have been arrested long ago
irish: an tuairim atá ag páiste amháin gur seafóid atá sa dráma toisc gur fadó riamh a bheadh an bhaicle gafa dá ndéanfaidís iad féin a iompar mar a rinne

english: reflect on whether parents generally behave as the parents in the drama did
irish: léirsmaoineamh a dhéanamh ar an gceist seo: an ndéanann tuismitheoirí i gcoitinne iad féin a iompar faoi mar a rinne na tuismitheoirí sa dráma?

english: reflect, as a result of doing a drama on a dolmen, on the number of problems people in the past had to solve to get us to the world we have today
irish: de thoradh na drámaíochta a rinneadh faoi thuama ursanach, léirsmaoineamh a dhéanamh ar an méid fadhbanna a bhí le sárú ag daoine anallód chun an t-imshaol atá againn inniu a chruthú

english: the archaeologists from Tutankhamun’s tomb are compiling a history of the dig, and each expert must profile himself/herself and explain his/her work
irish: tá cartlannaithe thuama Tutankhamun ag tiomsú stair na tochailte agus ní mór do gach duine acu beathaisnéis ghearr air/uirthi féin a chur i láthair agus a c(h)uid oibre a mhíniú

english: discover how relationships develop in a scene in which the light has suddenly gone off in the haunted house
irish: an fhorbairt a thagann ar chaidreamh a fhionnachtain i radharc ina dteipeann go tobann ar an solas i dteach a bhfuil taibhsí ann

english: discover how tribal rivalries influence relationships when food is being distributed
irish: an tionchar a bhíonn ag iomaíocht idir threibheanna ar chaidreamh nuair a bhíonn bia á roinnt a fhionnachtain

english: discover what relationships develop between people when they are worried about whether their relatives will survive the storm at sea
irish: an caidreamh a fhásann idir dhaoine nuair a bhíonn imní orthu an dtiocfaidh gaolta leo slán trí stoirm ar an bhfarraige a fhionnachtain

english: from a map supplied by the teacher, decide how best to get to the house of the friendship-maker
irish: le cabhair léarscáile a chuireann an múinteoir ar fáil, a shocrú cé acu bealach ab fhearr a ghabháil go dtí teach an fhir a dhéanann cairdeas

english: in an Irish-language play, decide what to do when a farmer has gone to the Gardaí after learning that he/she, as a member of the group, is trespassing on the farmer’s land, and abide by that decision and its consequences within the drama
irish: i ndráma Gaeilge, a shocrú cad is ceart a dhéanamh, anois go bhfuil feirmeoir tar éis dul go dtí na Gardaí tar éis dó a chlos go bhfuil sé/sí, mar bhall den ghrúpa, ag foghlú ar thalamh an fheirmeora, cloí leis an gcinneadh sin agus glacadh lena iarmhairt

english: in small-group work, keep the improvisation going without repetition in order to ensure invention and creativity
irish: in obair mhionghrúpaí, tobchumadh a choinneáil ar siúl ach gan athrá, d'fhonn airgtheacht agus cruthaitheacht a chinntiú

english: when, on an upturned boat, food rations are running out, decide as a member of the group whether to eat now and hope the group is rescued or to ration the food to make it last longer
irish: nuair atá an bád iompaithe bunoscionn san fharraige agus an lón bia ag dul i ndísc, a chinneadh mar bhall den ghrúpa cé acu ab fhearr tosú ag ithe anois agus a bheith ag súil go ndéanfar an grúpa a tharrtháil nó an bia a chiondáil agus síneadh a bhaint as

english: co-operate with other members of the group in making an art representation of the kind of world the crag-people live in
irish: comhoibriú le baill eile an ghrúpa agus léiriú ealaíne á dhéanamh ar an sórt saoil a gcónaíonn muintir na gcreag ann

english: in small-group work, exchange roles so that each member of the group has a chance to contribute in the making of each character
irish: rólanna a mhalartú le chéile i mionghrúpaí oibre sa chaoi go bhfaighidh gach ball den ghrúpa deis a chion féin a thairiscint agus gach carachtar á mhúnlú

english: research the kinds of domestic and farming implements people used a thousand years ago in order to experience in drama the kind of work they might do
irish: taighde a dhéanamh ar na cineálacha uirlise tí agus feirme a d'úsáideadh daoine míle bliain ó shin chun taithí a fháil trí mheán na drámaíochta ar an gcineál oibre a d'fhéadfaidís a dhéanamh

english: as part of a drama on the making of a dolmen, show half a minute of action in which the members of the tribe endure great hardship
irish: mar chuid de dhrámaíocht faoi pháistí ag tógáil tuama ursanaigh, leírigh leathnóiméid de ghníomhaíocht ina bhfulaingíonn baill na treibhe cruatan

english: in a drama about a crime, show, as groups of detectives, an enactment of how each group thinks it happened
irish: léirigh, i ról mar ghrúpaí bleachtairí i ndráma faoi choir, mar a cheapann gach grúpa a tharla an choir

english: in a drama about life on a tropical island, show how the relationship between the girls develops when they go swimming in the sea
irish: i ndráma faoin saol in oileán teochreasach, a léiriú cé mar a fhásann an gaol caidrimh idir na cailíní nuair a théann siad ag snámh san fharraige

english: show the scene at home when the teacher’s letter arrives to say that Jenny has been misbehaving
irish: léirigh mar a bhí cúrsaí sa bhaile nuair a seachadadh litir an mhúinteora ag insint go raibh Jenny á mí-iompar féin

english: follow the leader in hauling weapons along a narrow mountain pass
irish: leantar an cinnire agus na hairm á n-iompar tríd an mbearna chaol sléibhe

english: help the other children to teach the spacewoman how to treat the flowers
irish: cabhraítear leis na páistí an spásaire a theagasc chun na bláthanna a shaothrú

english: learn and apply simple rules that give focus and meaning to dramatic activity, for example ‘do your bit,’ ‘believe it is happening to you,’ ‘listen to and accept the contributions of others’
irish: na rialacha simplí a thugann fócas agus brí do ghníomhaíocht dhrámata a shealbhú agus a chur i bhfeidhm, mar shampla 'déan do chuid', 'creid é, tá sé ag tarlú duit', 'éist le tuairimí daoine eile agus tóg ceann díobh'

english: work out from the map the meaning of the riddle that will lead him/her to where the UFO has landed
irish: ciall an tomhais a threoróidh é/í chuig an áit ar thuirling an UFO a dhéanamh amach ón léarscáil

english: bí in ann script ghearr Ghaeilge a láimhseáil agus dráma a dhéanamh di
irish: bí in ann script ghearr Ghaeilge a láimhseáil agus dráma a dhéanamh di

english: it is the turn of the hieroglyphics expert to entertain campsite colleagues by enacting the story of hieroglyphics he/she has copied
irish: is é uain an tsaineolaí iairiglifí spraoi a dhéanamh dá c(h)omhghleacaithe sa champa oibre trí scéal na n-iairiglifí a rinne sé/sí a chóipeáil a léiriú

english: learn to look on a piece of script as an invitation to create dramatic action, discovering that interpreting six lines of script, for example, can lead into many different situations
irish: a fhoghlaim gur ceart breathnú ar phíosa scripte mar chuireadh chun gníomhaíocht dhrámata a chruthú agus a fhionnachtain go bhféadfadh go leor gníomhaíochtaí difriúla eascairt as sé líne scripte

english: learn to transform script into one’s own thought processes
irish: teacht isteach ar a phróiseas machnaimh féin a dhéanamh de script

english: a greedy worker at the tomb of Tutankhamun tempts others who are busy making copies of hieroglyphics to steal what they can
irish: spreagann oibrí santach ag tuama Tutankhamun daoine atá gnóthach i mbun cóipeanna d'iairiglifí a dhéanamh chun gach is féidir leo a ghoid

english: brief a third character, who is joining the drama, with an agenda that is not known to the two who are already involved
irish: mionteagasc a thabhairt don triú carachtar atá ar tí páirt a ghlacadh sa drámaíocht agus beartas dá c(h)uid féin aige/aici nach bhfuil aon eolas ina thaobh ag an mbeirt atá gafa sa drámaíocht cheana

english: enact the scene when, in the market-place where Miolchu is buying Patrick, one of the hostages tries to escape
irish: léirigh an radharc nuair a dhéanann duine de na gialla iarracht ar éaló ó lár an mhargaidh, áit a bhfuil Miolchu ag ceannach Phádraig

english: in a drama about differences between two groups of children, increase the tension by implanting the knowledge that any person in a particular group could be a spy for the other group
irish: i ndrámaíocht faoi na difríochtaí idir dhá ghrúpa páistí, cuirtear leis an teannas trína chur i dtuiscint do chách go bhféadfadh duine ar bith i gceann de na grúpaí bheith ina spiaire ag an ngrúpa eile

english: become aware of how the need to move away increases as soon as the decision to betray a friend is made
irish: mar a mhéadaíonn ar an bhfonn imeachta a luaithe agus a chinntear ar fheall a dhéanamh ar chara a thabhairt faoi deara

english: become aware of how the protagonists in an argument, gradually moving closer to each other, can increase the expectation that they may soon come to blows
irish: a thabhairt faoi deara gur féidir le hiomaitheoirí argóna agus iad ag druidim i dtreo a chéile go dréimreach an bharúil a threisiú gur gearr go mbeidh siad i gcochall a chéile

english: imagine any object as a machine that he/she is trying to sell at the market
irish: rud éigin a shamhlú mar mheaisín a bhfuil sé/sí ag iarraidh é a dhíol ar an margadh

english: imagine PE mats as magic carpets that fly to different places
irish: na mataí corpoideachas a shamhlú mar bhrait dhraíochta ar féidir leo eitilt go críocha éagsúla

english: déan dráma ina dtarlaíonn easaontas i measc grúpa páistí ag imirt cluiche ‘hopscotch’
irish: déan dráma ina dtarlaíonn easaontas i measc grúpa páistí ag imirt cluiche 'cleas na bacóide'

english: in a drama about a family situation, experience the anger and frustration arising from a conflict over changing the television channel
irish: i ndráma faoi chor i saol teaghlaigh, an fhearg agus an frustrachas a eascraíonn as coimhlint i dtaobh athrú an chainéal teilifíse a eispéiriú

english: using the ‘mantle of the expert’, the teacher helps the children to enter into the fiction by reading a letter from Lord Caernarfon inviting them to Egypt on a dig for Tutankhamun’s tomb
irish: agus 'hata an tsaineolaí' á chaitheamh aige/aici, cabhraíonn an múinteoir leis na páistí páirt a ghlacadh san fhicsean trí litir ón Tiarna Caernarfon a léamh dóibh, litir ina dtugtar cuireadh dóibh teacht ar fheachtas chun na hÉigipte chun tuama Tutankham

english: while accepting a commitment to the fictional consequences, take on the task of creating a welcome for members of a rival tribe whose help is needed in building a dolmen
irish: i gcomhthéacs ina bhfuiltear sásta glacadh lena n-iarmhairtí ficseanacha, tabhairt faoi fháiltiú a bheartú le haghaidh ball treibhe lena bhfuil siad in iomaíocht ach a bhfuil a gcabhair ag teastáil chun tuama ursanach a thógáil

english: Aengus knows that Patrick is holy and doesn’t want to disturb his prayers, but when Patrick stakes Aengus’ foot by mistake enact what happens next
irish: tá a fhios ag Aonghas go bhfuil Pádraig naofa agus ní maith leis cur isteach ar a phaidreacha; léirigh an méid a tharlaíonn nuair a shánn Pádraig cos Aonghasa de thaisme

english: knowing that the tide is coming in fast and that some of the children can’t swim, decide whether to try and wade to safety or spend the night on the island
irish: agus é ar eolas go bhfuil an taoide ag tuilleadh go tapaidh agus nach bhfuil snámh ag cuid de na páistí, a chinneadh cé acu ab fhearr iarracht a dhéanamh ar lapadaíl go háit slán nó an oíche a chaitheamh ar an oileán

english: the members of the tribe, having had the experience of trying to move the stone and desiring to go home to help their starving kinsmen, decide whether to bring the stone home or let it sink into the bog
irish: tar éis taithí ar bheith ag iarraidh an chloch a bhogadh agus fonn a bheith anois orthu filleadh ar an mbaile chun teacht i gcabhair ar a muintir, atá stiúgtha ag an ocras, ní mór do bhaill na treibhe a chinneadh cé acu an dtabharfaidh siad an chloch leo

english: the parents, knowing that a child has fallen into the lake, decide to find out how it happened
irish: agus a fhios acu gur thit an páiste isteach sa loch, cinneann na tuismitheoirí ar a fháil amach cé mar a tharla an timpiste

english: a whale has landed on the shore: encourage the children to become certain people with attitudes to the whale (other than the children’s own)
irish: tá míol mór tar éis teacht i dtír ar an trá: spreagtar na páistí chun a ligean orthu féin gur daoine áirithe iad a bhfuil dearcadh faoi leith acu i leith an mhíl mhóir (dearcadh nach ionann le dearcadh na bpáistí féin)

english: in a boat scene a group member is briefed to show, in role, how reflective (St.) Patrick is, compared with the other hostages
irish: i radharc ar bord loinge cuirtear mionteagasc ar bhall amháin den ghrúpa a léiriú chomh smaointeach is atá (Naomh) Pádraig i gcomparáid leis na gialla eile

english: in role as members of a tribe, the children decide to build a dolmen, but as their characters develop through the drama they decide to abandon the project
irish: ina rólanna mar bhaill treibhe, cinneann na páistí ar thuama ursanach a thógáil, ach de réir mar a thagann forbairt ar a gcarachtair i gcaitheamh na drámaíochta cinneann siad ar éirí as an tionscadal

english: the Children of Lir meet a group of people who have diverse attitudes to swans
irish: castar Clann Lir ar ghrúpa daoine a bhfuil tuairimí éagsúla acu i leith ealaí

english: if one were to make a soap-opera about the school, enact with others a small group scene that would best encapsulate the school
irish: dá mbeadh ar dhuine sraithscéal a dhéanamh i dtaobh na scoile, an radharc is fearr a thabharfadh léargas ar an scoil a léiriú mar radharc ghrúpa i dteanntale páistí eile

english: small groups depict people’s reactions at moments of great change in history
irish: léiríonn grúpaí beaga freagairt daoine ag ócáidí mórathruithe sa stair

english: through a drama about a child whose parents never let him/her do what he/she wants to do, explore and ask questions about freedom and responsibility
irish: trí mheán dráma i dtaobh páiste nach gceadaíonn a t(h)uismitheoirí dó/di choíche a rogha rud a dhéanamh, ceisteanna i dtaobh saoirse agus freagrachta a chur agus a iniúchadh

english: decide whether the drama is exciting enough and what could be done to make it more exciting
irish: cinneadh an bhfuil an drámaíocht sách spreagúil agus machnamh ar a bhféadfaí a dhéanamh chun é a dhéanamh níos spreagúla fós

english: he/she wonders if a parent would treat his/her child in this way and what direction the drama could take if he/she were kinder
irish: fiafraíonn sé/sí de/di féin an mar seo a chaithfeadh tuismitheoir lena p(h)áiste agus cén chríoch a d'fhéadfadh bheith ar an drámaíocht dá mbeadh sé/sí féin níos cineálta

english: in a drama about friendship, the cowboy wonders if he should have told the sheriff what he had seen his friend do
irish: i ndrámaíocht faoi chairdeas fiafraíonn an buachaill bó de féin ar chóir dó a insint don sirriam cad a chonaic sé á dhéanamh ag a chara

english: discuss one child’s opinion that the drama is silly, because if the gang had behaved like that they would have been arrested long ago
irish: an tuairim atá ag páiste amháin gur seafóid atá sa dráma toisc gur fadó riamh a bheadh an bhaicle gafa dá ndéanfaidís iad féin a iompar mar a rinne

english: reflect on whether parents generally behave as the parents in the drama did
irish: léirsmaoineamh a dhéanamh ar an gceist seo: an ndéanann tuismitheoirí i gcoitinne iad féin a iompar faoi mar a rinne na tuismitheoirí sa dráma?

english: reflect, as a result of doing a drama on a dolmen, on the number of problems people in the past had to solve to get us to the world we have today
irish: de thoradh na drámaíochta a rinneadh faoi thuama ursanach, léirsmaoineamh a dhéanamh ar an méid fadhbanna a bhí le sárú ag daoine anallód chun an t-imshaol atá againn inniu a chruthú

english: the archaeologists from Tutankhamun’s tomb are compiling a history of the dig, and each expert must profile himself/herself and explain his/her work
irish: tá cartlannaithe thuama Tutankhamun ag tiomsú stair na tochailte agus ní mór do gach duine acu beathaisnéis ghearr air/uirthi féin a chur i láthair agus a c(h)uid oibre a mhíniú

english: All at Sea'
irish: 'Ar an bhFarraige'

english: loud, short sound: shark (cymbal struck on the side)
irish: fuaim ghlórach ghearr: siorc (ciombal a bhualadh ar a thaobh)

english: medium pitch: dolphin (melodic instrument)
irish: airde meánach: deilf (uirlis shéiseach)

english: pulse, rhythm, melody, dynamics (loud/soft), structure (beginning, middle, end, repetition) and texture (sound combinations)
irish: cuisle, rithim, séis, dinimic (glórach/bog), comhdhéanamh (tús, lár, deireadh,athdhéanamh) agus uigeacht (teaglamaí fuaime)

english: simple melody accompanied by a steady pulse as a first section, a contrasting middle section and then the melody repeated again
irish: séis shimplí agus buille cothrom á tionlacan mar chéad mhír, mír i lár baill i gcodarsnacht léi sin agus ansin an tséis á hathdhéanamh arís

english: soft, high pitch, fast: plankton, little fish (small triangle)
irish: bog, tuinairde ard tapa: planctón, éisc bheaga (triantán beag)

english: soft, long sound: eels (chime bars or gong)
irish: fuaim bhog fhada: eascann (barraí clingíní nó gang)

english: child: 'm r d d'
irish: páiste: 'm r d d'

english: clap or tap
irish: buail nó cnág

irish: http://nccaplanning.ie/images/content_objectives/Music_ThirdFourth_Composing_Improvising.jpg

english: or using melodic instruments
irish: nó uirlisí séiseacha a úsáid

english: ostinato (a pattern that is repeated) to familiar songs
irish: ostinato (patrún a athdhéantar) d'amhráin choitianta

english: singing conversations
irish: comhráite canta

english: teacher: 'l s m r ...'
irish: múinteoir: 'l s m r ...'

english: while singing 'Train is a-coming'
irish: le linn ‘Train is a-coming’ a chanadh

english: a clown, an old man, a spy
irish: áilteoir, seanfhear, spiaire

english: a walk in the jungle
irish: siúlóid sa dufair

english: an accident
irish: timpiste

english: atmosphere in sound
irish: atmaisféar i bhfuaim

english: carnival music
irish: ceol carnabhail

english: characters
irish: pearsana

english: sequences of events including sound effects
irish: sraitheanna eachtraí le maisíochtaí fuaime

english: space music
irish: ceol spásúlach

english: how he/she enjoyed exploring the sounds, alone or with others, and what he/she liked best
irish: conas ar thaitin sé leis/léi na fuaimeanna a iniúchadh go haonarach nó le daoine eile agus an rud ab fhearr a thaitin leis/léi

english: how the instruments were selected
irish: mar ar roghnaíodh na huirlisí

english: how the sounds were produced
irish: conas a rinneadh na fuaimeanna

english: what changes are necessary
irish: cad iad na hathruithe atá riachtanach

english: what effects they produced
irish: cad iad na maisíochtaí a tháirgigh siad

english: whether he/she succeeded in his/her intentions
irish: ar éirigh leis/léi na cuspóirí a bhí aige/aice a aimsiú

english: graphic symbols
irish: siombailí grafacha

english: http://nccaplanning.ie/images/content_objectives/Music_ThirdFourth_Composing_TalkingAbout1.jpg
irish: http://nccaplanning.ie/images/content_objectives/Music_ThirdFourth_Composing_TalkingAbout1.jpg

irish: nodaireacht chaighdeánach

english: using the school equipment, a child's basic tape recorder, keyboard, computer
irish: úsáid a bhaint as fearas scoile, as téipthaifeadán simplí páiste, as méarchlár, as ríomhaire

english: bird sounds
irish: ceiliúr éin

english: car alarms
irish: aláraim ghluaisteáin

english: house alarms

irish: doimhneacht, sruthanna, taoidí, an aimsir, truailliú, hipiteirme

irish: sá-pheil uisce

english: kicking like a frog
irish: ciceáil ar nós froig

irish: an cluiche Deir Síomón a imirt -- na gníomhaíochtaí a bheith ag teacht le cumas na bpáistí

irish: ag seachadadh leis an lámh dheas agus ag glacadh leis an lámh chlé

irish: an chos tosaigh a fhorbairt agus trí abhóg reatha a thabhairt idir na cliatha

irish: rith in éineacht le cara nó le grúpa

english: observing good technique when hurdling
irish: dea-theicníocht le linn cliathreathaíochta a thabhairt faoi deara

english: discussing the effect of running three strides between each hurdle
irish: tionchar trí abhóg a thabhairt idir na cliatha a phlé

irish: dúshláin phearsanta a thabhairt le linn bheith ag rith feadh achair, tríd an t-achar a ritheadh a thomhas agus a chlárú gach 30 soicind d'fhonn ráta cothrom a bhunú

irish: an t-achar malartaithe a mhodhnú d'fhonn an riail faoi mhalartú an bhata a thionscnamh

english: comparing the length of a standing long jump to a jump with an approach run
irish: fad léime as seasamh agus fad léime le ruthag a chur i gcomparáid

irish: a trí nó a cúig d'abhóga a thabhairt agus léimneach ar mhaithe le fad

irish: an t-achar malartaithe a mhodhnú d'fhonn an riail faoi mhalartú an bhata a thionscnamh

english: comparing the length of a standing long jump to a jump with an approach run
irish: fad léime as seasamh agus fad léime le ruthag a chur i gcomparáid

english: exploring the theme of robots, contrasting the controlled, rigid action of a robot moving directly through space and the abandoned, flexible action of the robot out of control weaving through space
irish: agus téama na róbat á iniúchadh, gníomhú stiúrtha righin an róbait agus é ag gluaiseacht caol díreach trí spás a chur i gcodarsnacht le gníomhú rábach solúbtha an róbait atá gan stiúir agus é ag sníomh trí spás

english: when creating a dance about a storm, showing sharp, strong, direct movement performed in unison with others and repeated in canon individually to express build-up of thunder and lightning
irish: agus damhsa mar gheall ar stoirm á cheapadh, luail ghéar thréan dhíreach agus í déanta i gcomhréir le páistí eile a léiriú agus í a athdhéanamh ansin duine ar dhuine i bhfoirm chanóna d'fhonn neartú na toirní agus na tintrí a chur in iúl

english: copying and contrasting
irish: aithris agus codarsnacht

english: following and imitating a partner
irish: páirtí a leanúint agus aithris a dhéanamh air/uirthi

english: meeting and parting
irish: bualadh le chéile agus scaradh

english: expressing joy, anger, sorrow
irish: áthas, fearg, brón a chur in iúl

english: travelling through the space in curved and straight pathways, explore the changing shapes of the body and the use of different levels and directions possible in each pathway
irish: le linn taistil tríd an spás ar chonairí cuaracha agus díreacha, cruthanna malartacha an choirp mar aon leis na leibhéil agus na treonna difriúla atá inúsáidte i ngach conair a iniúchadh

english: combining movements of different parts of the body to create sequences of body parts moving one after the other: shoulders followed by hips, followed by wrists, followed by head
irish: luailí bhaill dhifriúla an choirp a nascadh d'fhonn sraitheanna a chruthú ina mbeidh baill choirp ar bogadh ceann i ndiaidh a chéile: na guaillí agus ansin na cromáin, ansin na rostaí, ansin an ceann

english: exploring different ways of crossing a space, e.g. when the body is being blown about by wind and body weight is shifting from one body part to another: hands to feet, one foot to the other, bottom to back to side
irish: bealaí éagsúla chun spás a thrasnú a iniúchadh, m.sh. nuair a bhíonn an corp á shíobadh ag an ngaoth agus meáchan an choirp á aistriú ó bhall coirp amháin go dtí ceann eile: ó na lámha go dtí na cosa, ó chos amháin go dtí cos eile, ón tóin go dtí an droim

english: walking, running and jumping sequences coordinated with a range of arm, head and upper body movement
irish: sraitheanna siúil, reatha agus léimní a chomhordú le raon luaile ina bhfuil na lámha, an ceann agus uachtar an choirp i gceist

english: Harvest Time Jig, Ionsaí na hInse
irish: Port an Fhómhair, Ionsaí na hInse

english: Shoemaker's Dance, German Clap Dance, Hazel Nut Dance
irish: Damhsa an Ghréasaí, an Damhsa Boise Gearmánach, Damhsa an Chnó Coill

english: pausing appropriately, anticipating the next phrase
irish: stopadh de réir mar is cuí, an chéad fhrása eile a réamhghabháil

english: exploring the theme of outer space, using stimuli of pictures of spaceships; creating in a small group a phrase of movement showing assembly of a rocket, take-off, flight pattern through space
irish: téama an spáis amuigh a iniúchadh agus pictiúir de spásárthaigh á n-úsáid mar spreagthaigh; mír luaile a léireodh cóimeáil agus éirí roicéid agus a phatrún eitilte trí spás a chruthú i ngrúpa beag

english: bouncing steps, arms swinging implying happy, joyful mood
irish: céimeanna preabacha agus lámha ag luascadh -- mothú sona, áthasach á mhaíomh

english: dragging feet, downcast head implying sad, miserable feeling
irish: cosa ar liobairne agus ceann cromshúileach -- mothú brónach, dearóil á mhaíomh

english: commenting on body control and facial expression of a dancer
irish: corprialú agus dreach éadain damhsóra a phlé

english: comparing and contrasting the movements of folk dances from two different countries
irish: luailí damhsaí tíre ó dhá thír dhifriúla a chur i gcomparáid agus i gcodarsnacht

english: discussing the shape and action of a body travelling in a linear pathway to communicate aggression; discussing the shape and action of a body travelling in a curved pathway to communicate light-heartedness
irish: cruth agus gníomhú coirp atá ag taisteal ar chonair líneach d'fhonn ionsaí a chur i gcéill a phlé; cruth agus gníomhú coirp atá ag taisteal ar chonair chuarach d'fhonn meidhir a chur i gcéill a phlé

irish: cluichí buailte, ciceála, caite agus gabhála

english: prison ball, chasing games, tunnel ball
irish: liathróid phríosúín, cluichí fiaigh, liathróid tolláin

english: 4 v. 4 mini-rounders
irish: mionchluiche corr 4 v. 4

english: 5 v. 5 games of hockey or hurling with modified rules
irish: cluichí haca nó iomána 5 v. 5 le rialacha modhnaithe

english: 5 v. 5 mini-soccer, Gaelic football
irish: mionchluichí sacair nó peil Ghaelach, 5 v. 5

english: handball games
irish: cluichí liathróide láimhe

english: mini-basketball, mini-netball
irish: mionchluichí cispheile agus líonpheile

english: pair tennis or badminton using a net
irish: leadóg nó badmantan i mbeirteanna agus líon á úsáid

english: bowling at a target (e.g. a bat, skittles, a goal)
irish: babhláil le sprioc (m.sh. slacán, scidilí, cúl)

english: gathering a large oval or round ball or a small ball off the ground while moving
irish: liathróid mhór, í cruinn nó ubhchruthach, nó liathróid bheag a scaobadh den talamh le linn bheith ag gluaiseacht

english: throwing and catching a large round or oval ball or a small ball while moving
irish: liathróid mhór, í cruinn nó ubhchruthach, nó liathróid bheag a chaitheamh agus a cheapadh le linn bheith ag gluaiseacht

english: throwing at or into a small target (e.g. a basket, a net)
irish: caitheamh le sprioc bheag nó isteach inti (m.sh. cis nó líon)

english: dribbling a ball around obstacles using a hurley or hockey stick
irish: liathróid a ghibreacht timpeall bacainní agus camán nó maide haca á úsáid

english: fisting a ball through the air to a partner, who catches and returns it using a bounce pass or an under-arm throw
irish: liathróid a dhornáil tríd an aer chuig páirtí -- beireann seisean/sise uirthi agus seolann ar ais í le preabphas nó le hurchar giolcaí

english: from a stationary position, bouncing or striking a ball or shuttlecock on a racquet (forehand and backhand alternately) into the air without allowing it to touch the ground
irish: as a s(h)easamh, liathróid nó eiteán a phreabadh nó a bhualadh suas san aer le raicéad (tulbhuille agus cúlbhuille gach re seach), gan ligean dó teagmháil leis an talamh

english: repeating the above while moving
irish: an méid thuas a athdhéanamh le linn bheith ag gluaiseacht

english: striking a ball over-arm against a wall using the hand
irish: liathróid a bhualadh go forlámhach in éadan balla leis an lámh

english: striking a ball using a racquet or bat to a partner, who returns it using an under-arm throw
irish: liathróid a bhualadh le raicéad nó slacán chuig páirtí a sheolann ar ais í d'urchar giolcaí

english: striking a ball using a racquet or bat to a partner, who strikes it back with the ball bouncing once between each strike
irish: liathróid a bhualadh le raicéad nó slacán chuig páirtí a bhuaileann ar ais í ar shlí go bpreabann sí uair amháin idir gach dhá bhuille

english: dribbling a ball around obstacles
irish: liathróid a ghibreacht timpeall bacainní

english: kicking a ball on the ground or through the air and moving into position to receive a pass
irish: liathróid a chiceáil ar an talamh nó tríd an aer agus dul chuig suíomh inar féidir glacadh le pas

english: kicking a ball through the air over a short distance to reach a partner, i.e. a kick pass
irish: liathróid a chiceáil tríd an aer feadh achair ghairid chun dul fad le páirtí, .i. Cicphas

english: passing and shooting the ball at a target
irish: liathróid a phasáil agus a radadh le sprioc

english: picking up a stationary or moving ball into the hands, using the foot
irish: liathróid atá ar stad nó ag bogadh a ardú go dtí na lámha leis an gcos

english: moving to an open space away from an opponent and seeking a pass
irish: imeacht go dtí spás oscailte amach ó chéile imeartha agus pas a lorg

english: applying simple principles of defence and attack, including the development of basic contact and dispossession (tackling) skills
irish: prionsabail shimplí chosanta agus ionsaithe a fheidhmiú, bunscileanna tadhaill agus díshealbhaithe (dul i ngleic) san áireamh

english: displaying basic support play in 2 v. 1 and 3 v. 1 situations
irish: imirt tacaíochta bhunúsach a léiriú sna tosca 2 v. 1 agus 3 v. 1

english: displaying basic teamwork in mini-games
irish: comhar bunúsach a léiriú in imirt mionchluichí

english: running, jumping, changing speed, stopping and starting
irish: rith, léimneach, athrú luais, stopadh agus tosú

english: striking, kicking, throwing and catching games
irish: cluichí buailte, ciceála, caite agus gabhála

english: prison ball, chasing games, tunnel ball
irish: liathróid phríosúín, cluichí fiaigh, liathróid tolláin

english: 4 v. 4 mini-rounders
irish: mionchluiche corr 4 v. 4

english: 5 v. 5 games of hockey or hurling with modified rules
irish: cluichí haca nó iomána 5 v. 5 le rialacha modhnaithe

english: 5 v. 5 mini-soccer, Gaelic football
irish: mionchluichí sacair nó peil Ghaelach, 5 v. 5

english: handball games
irish: cluichí liathróide láimhe

english: mini-basketball, mini-netball
irish: mionchluichí cispheile agus líonpheile

english: pair tennis or badminton using a net
irish: leadóg nó badmantan i mbeirteanna agus líon á úsáid

english: bowling at a target (e.g. a bat, skittles, a goal)
irish: babhláil le sprioc (m.sh. slacán, scidilí, cúl)

english: gathering a large oval or round ball or a small ball off the ground while moving
irish: liathróid mhór, í cruinn nó ubhchruthach, nó liathróid bheag a scaobadh den talamh le linn bheith ag gluaiseacht

irish: liathróid mhór, í cruinn nó ubhchruthach, nó liathróid bheag a chaitheamh agus a cheapadh le linn bheith ag gluaiseacht

english: throwing at or into a small target (e.g. a basket, a net)
irish: caitheamh le sprioc bheag nó isteach inti (m.sh. cis nó líon)

irish: liathróid a ghibreacht timpeall bacainní agus camán nó maide haca á úsáid

irish: rith, léimneach, athrú luais, stopadh agus tosú

english: jumping from one foot to two feet following a zigzag pathway, transferring weight onto hands and lowering the body into a forward roll
irish: léimneach ó chos amháin go dtí dhá chos agus conair i bhfiarláin á leanúint, an meáchan a aistriú go dtí na lámha agus an corp a ísliú agus rolladh ar aghaidh

irish: luailí ceannaireachta agus leanúna, ag gluaiseacht ón urlár go dtí an fearas

english: mirroring movements: where a child mirrors the actions of a partner
irish: luailí scáthántachta: déanann páiste macasamhail de ghníomhartha páirtí

english: producing a sequence using a springing movement and a rolling movement
irish: sraith ina n-úsáidtear luail phreabach agus luail rollach a tháirgeadh

irish: rolladh trasna mata, aistriú go dtí ball den fhearas (binse nó cuaille den fhráma dreaptha), taisteal thairis (de thruslóga nó ag sleamhnú), tuirlingt agus stopadh i gcruth sínte

english: evaluating a sequence performed by other children
irish: meastóireacht a dhéanamh ar shraith a chomhallann páistí eile

irish: meastóireacht a dhéanamh ar shraith pháirtí agus aiseolas a sholáthar dó/di

english: choosing a route and leading a partner, who draws the route taken on a plan
irish: bealach a thoghadh agus páirtí a ghiollacht; déanann an páirtí an bealach ceaptha a rianú ar phlean

english: finding controls by recognising and finding familiar features from photographs
irish: rialaitheoirí a aimsiú trí ghnéithe aitheanta a aithint agus a aimsiú as grianghraif

english: leading children around a route marked on a map and showing them how symbols are used to depict familiar features, i.e. a 'map walk'
irish: páistí a ghiollacht thart faoi bhealach rianaithe ar léarscáil agus a thaispeáint dóibh mar a úsáidtear siombailí chun gnéithe aitheanta a léiriú, .i. 'siúlóid léarscáile'

english: undertaking a journey following a chosen route and drawing it on a plan
irish: tabhairt faoi aistear ar bhealach ceaptha agus é a rianú ar phlean

english: finding one control marked on a map, recording a symbol found at this control and returning to base before setting out to find the next control
irish: ionad rialaithe amháin atá rianaithe ar léarscáil a aimsiú, siombail a aimsítear ag an ionad sin a chlárú, filleadh ar an mbunáit, agus imeacht ar thóir an chéad ionaid rialaithe eile

english: using an obstacle course (constructed indoors or outdoors) where the obstacles are placed so that children get from start to finish touching the ground only in marked allowed areas, with the help of other children
irish: bac-chúrsa (é déanta laistigh nó lasmuigh) ar a bhfuil na bacainní socraithe ar shlí gur féidir le páistí dul ó thús deireadh agus gan teagmháil leis an talamh, ach sna hachair sin atá marcáilte nó ceadaithe amháin, a úsáid agus páistí eile ag cuidiú leo

english: using marked forest trails and completing appropriate challenges at points indicated
irish: cosáin mharcáilte san fhoraois a úsáid agus dúshláin chuí a chomhlíonadh ag áiteanna atá ceaptha dóibh

english: standing on a plank with a group of children and re-arranging the group in alphabetical order without touching the ground (shuffle pack activity)
irish: seasamh ar chlár adhmaid le buíon pháistí agus an bhuíon a atheagrú in ord aibítre gan teagmháil leis an talamh (gníomhaíocht shuaitheadh an phaca)

english: caring for living things
irish: aire a thabhairt do dhúile beo

english: disposing of litter appropriately
irish: dramhaíl a chur i leataobh sa chaoi cheart

english: discussing different options available for moving from one control to the next when orienteering
irish: na roghanna atá ar fáil chun gluaiseacht ó ionad rialaithe go chéile le linn treodóireachta a phlé

english: planning courses for adventure activities
irish: cúrsaí le haghaidh gníomhaíochtaí eachtraíochta a phleanáil

english: the need for personal boundaries, having opportunities for uncluttered space, having opportunities to work individually
irish: an gá le teorainneacha pearsanta, deiseanna le haghaidh spáis gan tranglam a bheith ar fáil, deiseanna chun obair aonair a dhéanamh a bheith ar fáil

english: beginning to recognise how real feelings can sometimes be hidden from others
irish: mar is féidir le fíorbhraistintí a bheith ceilte ar dhaoine eile uaireanta a aithint

english: recognising how an individual action can affect the feelings of another
irish: mar a d'fhéadfadh gníomh aonair cur isteach ar bhraistintí duine eile a aithint

english: will I buy something with my money now or will I save for something more expensive later?
irish: an gceannóidh mé rud éigin le mo chuid airgid anois nó an ndéanfaidh mé é a shábháil ar mhaithe le ní éigin níos tairbhí amach anseo?

english: love, embarrassment, shyness, success, happiness, excitement, frustration, jealousy, anger, rage, loss, resentment, 'being put down' seeking help at an appropriate time and in an appropriate manner, naming and discussing the feeling, pausing, taking appro
irish: grá, náire, cúthaileacht, rath, sonas, scleondar, frustrachas, éad, fearg, buile, cailliúint, faltanas, á 'c(h)ur faoi chois', ag lorg cabhrach ag am agus ar bhealach oiriúnach, ag ainmniú agus ag plé na braistinte, ag moilliú, gníomh oiriúnach á dhéanamh

english: diet, rest, love, support and role of other family members, medical interventions
irish: réim bia, scíth, grá, tacaíocht agus ról ball teaghlaigh eile, idirghabháil leighis

english: developing sporting skills, playing chess, reading, developing critical thinking abilities, making new friends, joining clubs
irish: ag forbairt scileanna spóirt, ag imirt fichille, ag léamh,ag forbairt cumas machnaimh criticiúil, ag aimsiú cairde nua, ag dul isteach i gcumainn

english: smiling when hurt or angry, being withdrawn when afraid
being trusted
irish: iontaoibh a bheith as/aisti

english: choosing own reading materials
irish: ag roghnú a (h)ábhair léitheoireachta féin

english: doing jobs for self and parents
irish: ag déanamh tascanna dó/di féin agus do thuismitheoirí

english: becoming more reflective, using and appreciating quiet time, becoming more aware through exploring the senses, continuing to use his/her imagination and to wonder
irish: ag éirí níos machnamhaí, am ciúin á úsáid agus á léirthuiscint, ag éirí níos feasaí trí iniúchadh na gcéadfaí, ag leanúint le húsáid a s(h)amhlaíochta agus le bheith ag déanamh iontais

english: when I am afraid - what I did then and now
irish: nuair a bhíonn eagla orm -- a ndearna mé ansin agus a ndéanaim anois

english: when I need something - what I did then and now
irish: nuair a bhíonn gá agam le rud éigin -- a ndearna mé ansin agus a ndéanaim anois

english: highs' and 'lows': sports event, prizegiving, moving away, not winning a prize, not being chosen for a team
irish: pointí 'arda is ísle': imeacht spóirt, bronnadh duaiseanna, aistriú ar shiúl, gan duais a bhaint amach, gan áit ar fhoireann a ghnóthú

english: because they care for and love them
irish: toisc go bhfuil cion acu orthu agus grá acu dóibh

english: because they know how to keep them healthy
irish: toisc gurb eol dóibh conas iad a choinneáil sláintiúil

english: because they want to keep them safe
irish: toisc gur mian leo iad a choinneáil sábháilte

english: impulse values and beliefs
irish: luachanna agus creidimh

english: peer and media influences
irish: tionchar piaraí agus na meán cumarsáide

english: personal wishes and desires
irish: guíonna agus mianta pearsanta

english: social constraints
irish: baic shóisialta

english: wishes and directions of parent or teacher
irish: toil agus treoracha tuismitheora nó múinteora

english: considering the possible solutions and consequences
irish: ag déanamh machnaimh ar na réitigh agus ar na hiarmhairtí atá inoibrithe

english: identifying the important facts and/or the moral questions about the problem
irish: na fíricí tábhachtacha agus na ceisteanna morálta mar gheall ar an bhfadhb a aithint

english: implementing the decision
irish: an cinneadh á chur i bhfeidhm

english: pausing and thinking
irish: ag stad agus ag machnamh

english: reflecting on the choice or decision
irish: ag machnamh ar an rogha nó ar an gcinneadh

english: weighing up the advantages and disadvantages
irish: ag déanamh measúnú ar na buntáistí agus ar na míbhuntáistí

english: affirming, expressing sympathy, including others, isolating people, bullying, smoking, truancy, drinking alcohol
irish: ag dearbhú, ag cur comhbhróin in iúl, ag cuimsiú daoine eile, ag aonrú daoine, bulaíocht, ag caitheamh tobac, ag múitseáil, ag ól alcóil

english: safety measures: wearing protective headgear
irish: beartanna sábháilteachta: ceannbheart cosantach a chaitheamh

english: situations: in the water, at home, in the school yard, while visiting friends
irish: staideanna: san uisce, sa bhaile, i gclós na scoile, ar cuairt ag cairde

english: smoking a cigarette, tasting alcohol, climbing a wall
irish: ag caitheamh toitín, ag blaiseadh alcóil, ag dreapadh balla

english: adhering to rules about unsafe places
irish: ag cloí le rialacha faoi áiteanna neamhshábháilte

english: becoming familiar with emergency services and how to contact them
irish: bheith feasach ar sheirbhísí éigeandála agus conas teagmháil a dhéanamh leo

english: being assertive
irish: bheith treallúsach

english: not accepting bribes from anyone or taking lifts from unauthorised people
irish: gan glacadh le breabanna ó aon duine nó gan glacadh le síoba ó dhaoine neamhúdaraithe

english: realising how and when to get help
irish: conas agus cathain is ceart cabhair a lorg a thuiscint

english: telling people who are trustworthy
irish: ag insint do dhaoine atá iontaofa

english: telling someone where he/she is going at all times
irish: ag insint do dhuine éigin cá bhfuil a t(h)riall i gcónaí

english: at home, in school, on the farm, at the seaside
irish: sa bhaile, ar scoil, ar an bhfeirm, cois farraige

english: where medicines are obtained, the different ways in which medicines are taken, the positive benefits of taking medicine, the dangers of misusing medicine
irish: áiteanna is féidir leighis a fháil, na slite difriúla ina nglactar leighis, na buntáistí deimhneacha a bhaineann le glacadh leigheas, na dainséir a bhaineann le mí-úsáid leigheas

english: realising that individual action can keep others safe or can threaten safety
irish: a thuiscint gur féidir le gníomh aonair daoine eile a choimeád sábháilte nó a sábháilteacht a chur i mbaol

english: always asking a responsible adult before using any substance, learning about correct means of storage
irish: ceist a chur i gcónaí ar dhuine fásta freagrach sula n-úsáidtear aon substaint, foghlaim mar gheall ar mhodhanna cearta stórála

english: never touching, tasting or smelling unknown substances
irish: gan substaintí anaithnide a láimhsiú, a bhlaiseadh ná a bholú riamh

english: never transferring substances into other containers

irish: ag cuidiú leis an mbaile a choimeád slachtmhar

irish: ag cuidiú le haire a thabhairt do pháistí óga

english: sharing and co-operating with each other

irish: ag stad agus ag déanamh gnímh, iompraíocht threallúsach, ag aimsiú comhréitigh

irish: ag caint ar dhearcadh a nochtar agus ar dhearcadh daoine eile

irish: ag éisteacht le heispéiris agus le tuairimí daoine eile

irish: grámhaireacht, ceansacht, cúram a chur in iúl

irish: éachtaí agus buanna áitiúla agus náisiúnta a cheiliúradh

irish: roinnt dá líníochtaí a léirmhíniú mar chruth comhréidh nó mar scáthchruth le raon spéisiúil uigeachta

english: making a variety of relief prints
irish: priontaí éagsúla rilífeacha a dhéanamh

english: making monoprints, emphasising line, shape, texture
irish: monaiphriontaí a dhéanamh le béim ar líne, ar chruth agus ar uigeacht

english: making pictorial rubbings
irish: cuimilteáin phictiúrtha a dhéanamh

english: making silk-screen prints
irish: priontaí clóbhualadh criathair a dhéanamh

english: re-interpreting his/her observational drawings and sketches in relief prints
irish: athléirmhíniú a dhéanamh ar a líníochtaí agus ar a sceitsí breathnóireachta i bpriontaí rilífe

english: re-interpreting some of his/her drawings as flat shape
irish: roinnt dá líníochtaí a léirmhíniú mar chruth comhréidh

english: describing the print
irish: cur síos a dhéanamh ar an bprionta

english: line, shape and negative shape, texture, pattern, colour and tone and the effect achieved
irish: líne, cruth agus claonchruth, uigeacht, gréas, dath agus ton agus an toradh a baineadh amach

english: the decisions taken while working
irish: na socruithe a rinneadh le linn na hoibre

english: the most satisfactory elements or impact of the print
irish: na codanna is sásúla den phrionta nó a thionchar

english: the techniques used by the artist and speculating on why they were chosen
irish: na teicníochtaí ar bhain an t-ealaíontóir úsáid astu agus tuairimíocht faoin gcúis ar roghnaigh sé/sí iad

english: discovering how simple prints could be further developed
irish: mar a d'fhéadfaí priontaí simplí a fhorbairt a thuilleadh a fhionnachtain

english: experimenting with a related technique to make photograms that concentrate on expressive shape, negative shape, outline
irish: triail a bhaint as teicníocht ghaolmhar chun fótagraim ina gcuirtear béim ar chruth, chlaonchruth agus imlíne a dhéanamh

english: masking out areas and taking a further print
irish: achair a mhascadh agus prionta breise a dhéanamh

english: overlapping or placing shapes side by side
irish: rádalú nó cruthanna a leagan taobh le taobh

english: overprinting with contrasting shapes or colours
irish: forphriontáil a dhéanamh le cruthanna nó le dathanna codarsnacha

english: using an expanding colour range to create more complex images
irish: raon datha níos leithne a úsáid chun íomhánna níos coimpléascaí a chruthú

english: designing and printing cards and logos
irish: cártaí agus comharthaí a dhearadh agus a phriontáil

english: experimenting with fabric-printing techniques
irish: triail a bhaint as teicníochtaí priontála fabraice

english: making posters
irish: póstaeir a dhéanamh

english: combining with other print-making techniques
irish: comhcheangal a dhéanamh le teicníochtaí eile priontála

english: composing relief print blocks with line, shape, texture, pattern
irish: bloic phriontála rilífe a chumadh le líne, le cruth, le huigeacht agus le gréas

english: interpreting some of his/her drawings in terms of flat shape or silhouette together with some interesting textures
irish: roinnt dá líníochtaí a léirmhíniú mar chruth comhréidh nó mar scáthchruth le raon spéisiúil uigeachta

english: making a variety of relief prints
irish: priontaí éagsúla rilífeacha a dhéanamh

english: making monoprints, emphasising line, shape, texture
irish: monaiphriontaí a dhéanamh le béim ar líne, ar chruth agus ar uigeacht

english: making pictorial rubbings
irish: cuimilteáin phictiúrtha a dhéanamh

english: making silk-screen prints
irish: priontaí clóbhualadh criathair a dhéanamh

english: re-interpreting his/her observational drawings and sketches in relief prints
irish: athléirmhíniú a dhéanamh ar a líníochtaí agus ar a sceitsí breathnóireachta i bpriontaí rilífe

english: re-interpreting some of his/her drawings as flat shape
irish: roinnt dá líníochtaí a léirmhíniú mar chruth comhréidh

english: in a drama about the Famine, explore the relationships between the children who creep out at night into the potato field to see what their elders mean by blight
irish: i ndráma i dtaobh an Drochshaoil, na saghsanna caidrimh a fhásann idir na páistí a éalaíonn amach go formhothaithe san oíche go dtí garraí na bprátaí féachaint cad tá i gceist ag a sinsir le dubh na bprátaí a iniúchadh

english: in a drama allow the relationship between a character and his friend, whom he wants to look at some birds, to develop physically and emotionally as the scene is being enacted
irish: i bpíosa drámaíochta faoi charachtar agus chara ar mhaith leis/léi breathnú ar roinnt éan, ligtear don chaidreamh eatarthu forbairt go fisiceach agus go mothúchánach de réir mar a bhíonn an radharc á léiriú

english: in a drama in which a man from outer space, a landlubber, and a person who has never seen the night try to fish the moon out of the sea, explore the relationships that develop between them
irish: i ndráma ina bhfuil fear as an spás amuigh, duine nach eol dó/di an fharraige agus duine nach bhfaca an oíche riamh ag iarraidh an ghealach a iascach as an bhfarraige, déantar an caidreamh a éiríonn eatarthu a iniúchadh

english: as ‘experts’ on local history, research the kind of lives people led in 1925
irish: i ról mar 'shaineolaithe' ar an stair áitiúil, taighde a dhéanamh ar an gcineál saoil a chaith daoine sa bhlian 1925

english: for a drama about nomads and settlers, decide how best to arrange the wagons in case of attack
irish: i ndráma i dtaobh fánaithe agus lonnaitheoirí, cinneadh ar an eagar is fearr a chur ar na vaigíní i gcás ionsaithe

english: respond to the teacher’s probe, ‘Now that Celia has told the lie, can we tell the truth without seeming to let her down, or what will we do?’
irish: freagairt do dhúshlán an mhúinteora, 'Anois go bhfuil bréag inste ag Celia, an féidir linn an fhírinne a insint gan an chuma a bheith ar an scéal gur theipeamar uirthi, nó cad a dhéanfaimid?

english: as part of a group, work out what kind of scene will communicate most clearly to others in the class the kind of life lived in our grandparents’ time
irish: mar bhall de ghrúpa, cinneadh ar an sórt radhairc is fearr a léireoidh don chuid eile den rang an saghas saoil a chaith daoine in aimsir ár seanaithreacha agus seanmháithreacha

english: decide whether the women of the island should let the strangers know that the flowers growing on the hillside are extremely valuable
irish: a chinneadh ar cheart do mhná an oileáin a insint do na strainséirí go bhfuil na bláthanna sléibhe fíorluachmhar

english: decide who should undertake the various aspects of the research that is needed before proceeding with the drama
irish: a chinneadh cé a ghabhfaidh air/uirthi féin gnéithe éagsúla an taighde is gá a dhéanamh sula ngabhtar ar aghaidh leis an dráma

english: in a scene about a death at a wall-building project during Famine times, agree on when the focus should shift so that the story may unfold out of the action
irish: i radharc faoi bhás duine ar thionscadal tógála balla in aimsir an Drochshaoil, aontú i dtaobh an ama ab fhearr an fócas a aistriú chun go bhfásfadh an scéal as an ngníomhaíocht

english: respond in small groups to the teacher saying, ‘Let’s make a short play about fear’
irish: freagairt i mionghrúpaí do spreagadh an mhúinteora nuair a deir sé/sí 'Déanaimis dráma gearr i dtaobh na heagla'

english: as part of a comic piece about people who care about nothing, show a scene in which the hurlers or camogie players are completely uninterested in the lecture from the coach before the game
irish: mar chuid de sceits ghrinn faoi dhaoine nach fiú leo dada, radharc a léiriú ina bhfuil na hiománaithe nó na himreoirí camógaíochta agus gan aird dá laghad acu ar aitheasc an traenálaí roimh an gcluiche

english: as part of a drama on the bravery of peacemakers, enact the scene in which the hero or heroine says goodbye to his/her family before going on his/her mission
irish: mar chuid de dhrámaíocht faoi chrógacht lucht déanta na síochána, léiriú a thabhairt ar an radharc ina bhfágann an laoch slán ag a t(h)eaghlach roimh imeacht dó/di ar a f(h)eachtas

english: enact a scene that shows the reaction of a family to the news that they have won the lotto
irish: radharc a léiriú ina dtaispeántar mar a théann nuacht buaite an Chrannchuir i gcion ar bhaill teaglaigh

english: agree methods by which a drama in the dual setting of the sitting-room and the kitchen does not split into two separate dramas
irish: modhanna a bheartú a chinnteoidh nach scoiltfear drámaíocht atá ar siúl in dhá shuíomh, sa seomra suí agus sa chistin, in dhá dhrámaíocht ar leith

english: help to create and maintain the atmosphere in the cold damp room in which they wait for the ghost to come
irish: cuidiú le hatmaisféar an tseomra fhuair thais ina bhfuiltear ag fanacht le teacht an taibhse a chruthú agus a choinneá

english: mar dhuine de na cailíní atá ag lorg a máithreacha, ceistigh úinéir na feirme faoin méid a chonaic sé/sí
irish: i ról mar dhuine de na cailíní atá ag lorg a máithreacha, ceistigh úinéir na feirme faoin méid a chonaic sé/sí

english: ask the who, what, where, when and why questions in creating the action that a piece of script suggests
irish: ceisteanna mar cé hé, cad é, cén áit, cén uair agus cén fáth a chur agus an ghníomhaíocht a spreagtar le script áirithe á cruthú

english: be aware of the basic conventions of play-writing through occasionally writing sections of script for other groups to make into drama texts
irish: feasacht ar na bun-nósanna a ghabhann le scríobh drámaí a shealbhú trí phíosaí scripte a scríobh do ghrúpaí eile, ó am go ham, lena dtiontú ina dtéacsanna drámaíochta

english: perform simultaneously a few lines of script to lead to a drama about the issue of family break-up during the Famine
irish: cúpla líne scripte a léiriú go comhuaineach mar thús do dhrámaíocht i dtaobh scaipeadh teaghlach le linn an Drochshaoil

english: discover how space and the placing of things and people in space can provide information about relationships and happenings
irish: mar a fhéadfaidh an chaoi a bhfuil daoine agus rudaí suite i spás faisnéis a thabhairt i dtaobh caidrimh agus teagmhas a fhionnachtain

english: in a small-group Irish-language piece, arrange chairs and objects to represent an uninhabited house
irish: agus mionghrúpa ag gabháil do dhráma Gaeilge, cuirtear na cathaoireacha agus rudaí eile in eagar áirithe chun go léireoidís teach gan chónaí ann

english: work from a picture of a Famine cottage to the layout of objects to represent it
irish: ag baint leasa as pictiúr de bhothán in aimsir an Drochshaoil, rudaí a leagan amach chun an bothán a chur in iúl

english: begin to appreciate that, just like different games, different drama worlds (other than naturalistic drama) can have their own rules
irish: tosú ar a thuiscint gur féidir a rialacha féin a bheith ag na genres éagsúla drámaíochta (seachas drámaíocht nádúrtha), amhail mar a bhíonn i gcluichí

english: déan dráma greannmhar faoi nathair san áiléar
irish: drámaíocht ghreannmhar a dhéanamh faoi nathair san áiléar

english: do a drama in which the adults act like children and the children act like adults
irish: dráma a léiriú ina mbíonn na daoine fásta á n-iompar féin mar pháistí agus na páistí á n-iompar féin mar dhaoine fásta

english: invent an extra group of characters that Alice (in Wonderland) might meet, and do a scene she might have with them
irish: grúpa breise carachtar a cheapadh a d'fhéadfadh casadh ar Alice (i dTír na nIontas) agus an eachtra a d'éireodh di ina bhfochair a léiriú

english: to lift a drama out of the naturalistic mode, do a silent scene depicting action in a labour camp while the remainder of the class juxtaposes the sounds of children playing by the seaside
irish: chun dráma a chrochadh amach as an modh nádúrtha, radharc ciúin ina dtaispeánfaí eachtra éigin i gcampa oibre a léiriú agus aithris ar ghlórtha páistí ag súgradh ar an trá á déanamh ag an gcuid eile den rang sa chúlra ag an am céanna

english: enact a drama about green people from a dark world; engage, as in makebelieve play, with the feelings, emotions and thought processes of a person who has never seen brightness as he/she emerges into the light of day
irish: dráma i dtaobh daoine glasa ó dhomhan diamhair a léiriú; páirt a ghlacadh ann, faoi mar a dhéanfadh sé/sí i gcur i gcéill súgarthach, leis na mothúcháin, an tocht agus na próisis mhachnaimh a dhúiseofaí i nduine nach bhfaca solas ariamh nuair a bheadh sé/

english: in the same drama, enter fully and accurately into the prejudices of the first people to meet the green children
irish: sa dráma céanna, réamhchlaonta na chéad daoine ar casadh na páistí glasa orthu a léiriú go hiomlán, go cruinn agus i ról

english: mar shórt cluiche, déan dráma as liosta focal a thugtar dóibh
irish: mar shórt cluiche, déan dráma as liosta focal a thugtar dóibh

english: a group of scientists, deciding that the spacewoman should be allowed to stay, do an experiment on the composition of air to find out if she can live in this atmosphere
irish: tar éis dóibh a shocrú gur cheart a cheadú don spásbhean cur fúithi abhus, cuireann grúpa eolaithe turgnamh ar siúl ar chomhdhéanamh aeir d'fhonn a fháil amach an bhféadfadh sí maireachtáil san aerbhrat seo

english: the children of the Rhône valley, reading the signs of the wind that sweeps down the valley and knowing the danger of the wind, want to tell their parents to take precautions against it
irish: tar éis dóibh tuar na gaoithe a shéideann anuas an gleann a aithint agus a fhios acu chomh scriosach is atá sí mar ghaoth, is mian le páistí ghleann na Róine a rá lena dtuismitheoirí faichill a dhéanamh uirthi

english: the people of the island, knowing how the smugglers exploit them, have to decide whether their future is best assured by telling the police or by taking the law into their own hands
irish: agus a fhios acu mar atá cos ar bolg á dhéanamh ag na smuigléirí orthu, ní foláir do mhuintir an oileáin a chinneadh cé acu comhairle ab fhearr a dhéanfadh a leas amach anseo, tuairisc orthu a thabhairt do na póilíní nó a gcearta féin a bhaint amach le lá

english: accept the brief of looking at a character in terms of how he/she inhabits and moves in personal space (relate to dance)
irish: glacadh leis an mionteagasc breathnú ar charachtar agus ar an gcaoi a n-áitríonn sé/sí a spás pearsanta agus ar an gcaoi a ngluaiseann sé/sí laistighde (é seo a chomhghaolú le rince)

english: as the friendly mistress of the workhouse, the child holds back until the appropriate moment the news that the family must split up
irish: ina ról mar mháistreás lách theach na mbocht, coinníonn an páiste siar an scéala go gcaithfidh baill an teaghlaigh scarúint óna chéile go dtí an nóiméad tráthúil

english: on entering the scene where the children of the family are planning to emigrate, the member of the group who is playing the mother is told: ‘Don’t say a word; just be suspicious of what they have been talking about’
irish: i radharc ina bhfuil páistí an teaghlaigh ag beartú dul ar imirce, nuair athagann an té atá ag glacadh pháirt na máthar isteach deirtear léi: 'Ná habairfaic; ach bíodh amhras ort i dtaobh an mhéid a bhí á rá acu'

english: as members of a dance troupe in a drama about betrayal, make a dance that lets the queen know her secret is out
irish: ról mar bhall d'fhoireann damhsa i ndrámaíocht i dtaobh feille, damhsa achumadh a chuireann in iúl don bhanríon go bhfuil a rún scaoilte

english: as the fishermen depart for three months, leaving their families on the quays, help create and be aware of the tension that comes from everyone trying to be cheerful
irish: agus na hiascairí ag imeacht go ceann trí mhí agus a dteaghlaigh á bhfágáil ar an gcé acu, cabhraigh chun an teannas a mhúsclaítear i ngach aon duine de thoradh bheith ag iarraidh bheith meanmnach a chruthú agus bheith feasach air

english: in a drama about honesty, explore how contrary physical and verbal signals can indicate deception
irish: i ndrámaíocht i dtaobh macántachta, an dóigh ar féidir le teachtaireachtaí fisiceacha agus briathartha a thrasnaíonn a chéile cealg a chur in iúl a iniúchadh

english: beginning with the finding by the police of an abandoned wallet, see where the investigation leads and how it must be shaped by the rules by which the police abide
irish: agus na póilíní ag fáil sparáin a tréigeadh mar thúsphointe, treo an fhiosraithe a iniúchadh ach a thabhairt faoi deara go gcaithfear cloí leis na rialacha imeachta nach mór do na póilíní aird a thabhairt orthu

english: explore a mathematical problem through a ‘mantle of the expert’ drama about a builder who wants to renovate a church
irish: fadhb mhatamaitice i dtaobh tógálaí a dteastaíonn uaidh/uaithi séipéal a athnuachan a réiteach trí dhrámaíocht ina n-úsáidtear próiseas 'hata an tsaineolaí'

english: explore bullying through a drama about a boy or girl, his/her mother and father, a dog and a gang who attack him/her going to school
irish: bulaíocht a iniúchadh trí dhrámaíocht faoi bhuachaill nó chailín, a m(h)áthair agus a (h)athair, mhadra agus bhaicle a ionsaíonn é/í agus é/í ag dul ar scoil

english: decide as a member of a group whether the woman with the fur coat should be helped to meet the fur dealer who will repair it
irish: a shocrú, mar bhall de ghrúpa, ar cheart cabhrú le bean an chóta fhionnaidh chun bualadh leis an tráchtálaí fionnaidh, duine a dheiseoidh an cóta di

english: decide, as a member of the group, whether to allow a soldier to pass on and possibly get killed or to risk one’s own life to save him/her
irish: a shocrú, mar bhall de ghrúpa, cé acu a ligfear do shaighdiúir bualadh ar aghaidh agus seans go marófar é/í nó a b(h)eatha féin a chur i mbaol chun é/í a tharrtháil

english: participate in hot-seating
irish: duine a chur ar bhranraí teo

english: write the poem the character might write at this time (it is sometimes useful to distance true emotion from the child) and then decide what course of action he/she is likely to take
irish: an dán a scríobhfadh an carachtar ag an bpointe seo a chumadh agus a chinneadh ansin ar an rud is dóichí a dhéanfaidh sé/sí (uaireanta is é leas an pháiste dearbhmhothúcháin a dheighilt amach uaidh/uaithi)

english: as part of a group of Irish-speaking children, decide how best to teach the English girl to answer in Irish the questions the gardener will put to her
irish: mar bhall de ghrúpa páistí a labhraíonn Gaeilge cinneadh conas is fearr an cailín Sasanach a mhúineadh chun na ceisteanna a chuirfidh an garraíodóir uirthi as Gaeilge a fhreagairt

english: as part of a group, make a wall chart about the insights gained during a drama about a pop group and the conclusions for life that could be drawn from it
irish: mar bhall de ghrúpa, cairt bhalla a réiteach ar a léireofaí na léargais a nochtadh dóibh i ndrámaíocht i dtaobh pop-ghrúpa agus na tátáil don saol a d'fhéadfaí a bhaint astu

english: in a drama on board a sailing ship explore why the tired sailors might disagree with the captain and decide to take over the ship
irish: i ndrámaíocht suite ar bord loinge seoil, na fáthanna a n-éireodh idir na mairnéalaigh thraochta agus an captaen agus go ngabhfaidís an long a iniúchadh

english: in a drama about the Famine, explore the relationships between the children who creep out at night into the potato field to see what their elders mean by blight
irish: i ndráma i dtaobh an Drochshaoil, na saghsanna caidrimh a fhásann idir na páistí a éalaíonn amach go formhothaithe san oíche go dtí garraí na bprátaí féachaint cad tá i gceist ag a sinsir le dubh na bprátaí a iniúchadh
