irish: mar chuid de sceits ghrinn faoi dhaoine nach fiú leo dada, radharc a léiriú ina bhfuil na hiománaithe nó na himreoirí camógaíochta agus gan aird dá laghad acu ar aitheasc an traenálaí roimh an gcluiche

english: as part of a drama on the bravery of peacemakers, enact the scene in which the hero or heroine says goodbye to his/her family before going on his/her mission
irish: mar chuid de dhrámaíocht faoi chrógacht lucht déanta na síochána, léiriú a thabhairt ar an radharc ina bhfágann an laoch slán ag a t(h)eaghlach roimh imeacht dó/di ar a f(h)eachtas

english: enact a scene that shows the reaction of a family to the news that they have won the lotto
irish: radharc a léiriú ina dtaispeántar mar a théann nuacht buaite an Chrannchuir i gcion ar bhaill teaglaigh

english: agree methods by which a drama in the dual setting of the sitting-room and the kitchen does not split into two separate dramas
irish: modhanna a bheartú a chinnteoidh nach scoiltfear drámaíocht atá ar siúl in dhá shuíomh, sa seomra suí agus sa chistin, in dhá dhrámaíocht ar leith

english: help to create and maintain the atmosphere in the cold damp room in which they wait for the ghost to come
irish: cuidiú le hatmaisféar an tseomra fhuair thais ina bhfuiltear ag fanacht le teacht an taibhse a chruthú agus a choinneá

english: mar dhuine de na cailíní atá ag lorg a máithreacha, ceistigh úinéir na feirme faoin méid a chonaic sé/sí
irish: i ról mar dhuine de na cailíní atá ag lorg a máithreacha, ceistigh úinéir na feirme faoin méid a chonaic sé/sí

english: ask the who, what, where, when and why questions in creating the action that a piece of script suggests
irish: ceisteanna mar cé hé, cad é, cén áit, cén uair agus cén fáth a chur agus an ghníomhaíocht a spreagtar le script áirithe á cruthú

english: be aware of the basic conventions of play-writing through occasionally writing sections of script for other groups to make into drama texts
irish: feasacht ar na bun-nósanna a ghabhann le scríobh drámaí a shealbhú trí phíosaí scripte a scríobh do ghrúpaí eile, ó am go ham, lena dtiontú ina dtéacsanna drámaíochta

english: perform simultaneously a few lines of script to lead to a drama about the issue of family break-up during the Famine
irish: cúpla líne scripte a léiriú go comhuaineach mar thús do dhrámaíocht i dtaobh scaipeadh teaghlach le linn an Drochshaoil

english: discover how space and the placing of things and people in space can provide information about relationships and happenings
irish: mar a fhéadfaidh an chaoi a bhfuil daoine agus rudaí suite i spás faisnéis a thabhairt i dtaobh caidrimh agus teagmhas a fhionnachtain

english: in a small-group Irish-language piece, arrange chairs and objects to represent an uninhabited house
irish: agus mionghrúpa ag gabháil do dhráma Gaeilge, cuirtear na cathaoireacha agus rudaí eile in eagar áirithe chun go léireoidís teach gan chónaí ann

english: work from a picture of a Famine cottage to the layout of objects to represent it
irish: ag baint leasa as pictiúr de bhothán in aimsir an Drochshaoil, rudaí a leagan amach chun an bothán a chur in iúl

english: begin to appreciate that, just like different games, different drama worlds (other than naturalistic drama) can have their own rules
irish: tosú ar a thuiscint gur féidir a rialacha féin a bheith ag na genres éagsúla drámaíochta (seachas drámaíocht nádúrtha), amhail mar a bhíonn i gcluichí

english: déan dráma greannmhar faoi nathair san áiléar
irish: drámaíocht ghreannmhar a dhéanamh faoi nathair san áiléar

english: do a drama in which the adults act like children and the children act like adults
irish: dráma a léiriú ina mbíonn na daoine fásta á n-iompar féin mar pháistí agus na páistí á n-iompar féin mar dhaoine fásta

english: invent an extra group of characters that Alice (in Wonderland) might meet, and do a scene she might have with them
irish: grúpa breise carachtar a cheapadh a d'fhéadfadh casadh ar Alice (i dTír na nIontas) agus an eachtra a d'éireodh di ina bhfochair a léiriú

english: to lift a drama out of the naturalistic mode, do a silent scene depicting action in a labour camp while the remainder of the class juxtaposes the sounds of children playing by the seaside
irish: chun dráma a chrochadh amach as an modh nádúrtha, radharc ciúin ina dtaispeánfaí eachtra éigin i gcampa oibre a léiriú agus aithris ar ghlórtha páistí ag súgradh ar an trá á déanamh ag an gcuid eile den rang sa chúlra ag an am céanna

english: enact a drama about green people from a dark world; engage, as in makebelieve play, with the feelings, emotions and thought processes of a person who has never seen brightness as he/she emerges into the light of day
irish: dráma i dtaobh daoine glasa ó dhomhan diamhair a léiriú; páirt a ghlacadh ann, faoi mar a dhéanfadh sé/sí i gcur i gcéill súgarthach, leis na mothúcháin, an tocht agus na próisis mhachnaimh a dhúiseofaí i nduine nach bhfaca solas ariamh nuair a bheadh sé/

english: in the same drama, enter fully and accurately into the prejudices of the first people to meet the green children
irish: sa dráma céanna, réamhchlaonta na chéad daoine ar casadh na páistí glasa orthu a léiriú go hiomlán, go cruinn agus i ról

english: mar shórt cluiche, déan dráma as liosta focal a thugtar dóibh
irish: mar shórt cluiche, déan dráma as liosta focal a thugtar dóibh

english: a group of scientists, deciding that the spacewoman should be allowed to stay, do an experiment on the composition of air to find out if she can live in this atmosphere
irish: tar éis dóibh a shocrú gur cheart a cheadú don spásbhean cur fúithi abhus, cuireann grúpa eolaithe turgnamh ar siúl ar chomhdhéanamh aeir d'fhonn a fháil amach an bhféadfadh sí maireachtáil san aerbhrat seo

english: the children of the Rhône valley, reading the signs of the wind that sweeps down the valley and knowing the danger of the wind, want to tell their parents to take precautions against it
irish: tar éis dóibh tuar na gaoithe a shéideann anuas an gleann a aithint agus a fhios acu chomh scriosach is atá sí mar ghaoth, is mian le páistí ghleann na Róine a rá lena dtuismitheoirí faichill a dhéanamh uirthi

english: the people of the island, knowing how the smugglers exploit them, have to decide whether their future is best assured by telling the police or by taking the law into their own hands
irish: agus a fhios acu mar atá cos ar bolg á dhéanamh ag na smuigléirí orthu, ní foláir do mhuintir an oileáin a chinneadh cé acu comhairle ab fhearr a dhéanfadh a leas amach anseo, tuairisc orthu a thabhairt do na póilíní nó a gcearta féin a bhaint amach le lá

english: accept the brief of looking at a character in terms of how he/she inhabits and moves in personal space (relate to dance)
irish: glacadh leis an mionteagasc breathnú ar charachtar agus ar an gcaoi a n-áitríonn sé/sí a spás pearsanta agus ar an gcaoi a ngluaiseann sé/sí laistighde (é seo a chomhghaolú le rince)

english: as the friendly mistress of the workhouse, the child holds back until the appropriate moment the news that the family must split up
irish: ina ról mar mháistreás lách theach na mbocht, coinníonn an páiste siar an scéala go gcaithfidh baill an teaghlaigh scarúint óna chéile go dtí an nóiméad tráthúil

english: on entering the scene where the children of the family are planning to emigrate, the member of the group who is playing the mother is told: ‘Don’t say a word; just be suspicious of what they have been talking about’
irish: i radharc ina bhfuil páistí an teaghlaigh ag beartú dul ar imirce, nuair athagann an té atá ag glacadh pháirt na máthar isteach deirtear léi: 'Ná habairfaic; ach bíodh amhras ort i dtaobh an mhéid a bhí á rá acu'

english: as members of a dance troupe in a drama about betrayal, make a dance that lets the queen know her secret is out
irish: ról mar bhall d'fhoireann damhsa i ndrámaíocht i dtaobh feille, damhsa achumadh a chuireann in iúl don bhanríon go bhfuil a rún scaoilte

english: as the fishermen depart for three months, leaving their families on the quays, help create and be aware of the tension that comes from everyone trying to be cheerful
irish: agus na hiascairí ag imeacht go ceann trí mhí agus a dteaghlaigh á bhfágáil ar an gcé acu, cabhraigh chun an teannas a mhúsclaítear i ngach aon duine de thoradh bheith ag iarraidh bheith meanmnach a chruthú agus bheith feasach air

english: in a drama about honesty, explore how contrary physical and verbal signals can indicate deception
irish: i ndrámaíocht i dtaobh macántachta, an dóigh ar féidir le teachtaireachtaí fisiceacha agus briathartha a thrasnaíonn a chéile cealg a chur in iúl a iniúchadh

english: beginning with the finding by the police of an abandoned wallet, see where the investigation leads and how it must be shaped by the rules by which the police abide
irish: agus na póilíní ag fáil sparáin a tréigeadh mar thúsphointe, treo an fhiosraithe a iniúchadh ach a thabhairt faoi deara go gcaithfear cloí leis na rialacha imeachta nach mór do na póilíní aird a thabhairt orthu

english: explore a mathematical problem through a ‘mantle of the expert’ drama about a builder who wants to renovate a church
irish: fadhb mhatamaitice i dtaobh tógálaí a dteastaíonn uaidh/uaithi séipéal a athnuachan a réiteach trí dhrámaíocht ina n-úsáidtear próiseas 'hata an tsaineolaí'

english: explore bullying through a drama about a boy or girl, his/her mother and father, a dog and a gang who attack him/her going to school
irish: bulaíocht a iniúchadh trí dhrámaíocht faoi bhuachaill nó chailín, a m(h)áthair agus a (h)athair, mhadra agus bhaicle a ionsaíonn é/í agus é/í ag dul ar scoil

english: decide as a member of a group whether the woman with the fur coat should be helped to meet the fur dealer who will repair it
irish: a shocrú, mar bhall de ghrúpa, ar cheart cabhrú le bean an chóta fhionnaidh chun bualadh leis an tráchtálaí fionnaidh, duine a dheiseoidh an cóta di

english: decide, as a member of the group, whether to allow a soldier to pass on and possibly get killed or to risk one’s own life to save him/her
irish: a shocrú, mar bhall de ghrúpa, cé acu a ligfear do shaighdiúir bualadh ar aghaidh agus seans go marófar é/í nó a b(h)eatha féin a chur i mbaol chun é/í a tharrtháil

english: participate in hot-seating
irish: duine a chur ar bhranraí teo

english: write the poem the character might write at this time (it is sometimes useful to distance true emotion from the child) and then decide what course of action he/she is likely to take
irish: an dán a scríobhfadh an carachtar ag an bpointe seo a chumadh agus a chinneadh ansin ar an rud is dóichí a dhéanfaidh sé/sí (uaireanta is é leas an pháiste dearbhmhothúcháin a dheighilt amach uaidh/uaithi)

english: as part of a group of Irish-speaking children, decide how best to teach the English girl to answer in Irish the questions the gardener will put to her
irish: mar bhall de ghrúpa páistí a labhraíonn Gaeilge cinneadh conas is fearr an cailín Sasanach a mhúineadh chun na ceisteanna a chuirfidh an garraíodóir uirthi as Gaeilge a fhreagairt

english: as part of a group, make a wall chart about the insights gained during a drama about a pop group and the conclusions for life that could be drawn from it
irish: mar bhall de ghrúpa, cairt bhalla a réiteach ar a léireofaí na léargais a nochtadh dóibh i ndrámaíocht i dtaobh pop-ghrúpa agus na tátáil don saol a d'fhéadfaí a bhaint astu

english: in a drama on board a sailing ship explore why the tired sailors might disagree with the captain and decide to take over the ship
irish: i ndrámaíocht suite ar bord loinge seoil, na fáthanna a n-éireodh idir na mairnéalaigh thraochta agus an captaen agus go ngabhfaidís an long a iniúchadh

english: chime bar inventions, using notes C, D, E, G, A
irish: tionscnaimh don bharra clingíní, ag úsáid na nótaí C, D, E, G, A

english: creating a melody, with an underlying five-beat pulse, keeping a steady tempo, playing softly, loudly or with some contrast, playing some notes together and following a simple plan
irish: séis a chumadh, le cuisle chúig-bhuille, ag coinneál luas socair, ag seinm go bog, go glórach nó le codarsnacht áirithe, ag seinm roinnt nótaí le chéileagus ag leanúint plean shimplí

english: rhythm, melody, tempo, dynamics, texture (combinations of sounds) and simple structure
irish: rithim, séis, luas, dinimic, uigeacht (teaglamaí fuaime) agus comhdhéanamh simplí

english: child : 'm l l s m r d -- '
irish: páiste: 'm l l s m r d -- '

english: clap or tap
irish: buail nó cnág

irish: http://nccaplanning.ie/images/content_objectives/Music_FifthSixth_Composing_Improvising.jpg

english: rhythmic ostinato (a pattern that is repeated over and over) for familiar songs
irish: ostinato (patrún a léirítear arís agus arís eile) rithimeach d’amhráin choitianta

english: singing conversations
irish: comhráite canta

english: teacher: 'm l l s m r m -- '
irish: múinteoir: 'm l l s m r m -- '

english: using melodic instruments
irish: uirlisí séiseacha á n-úsáid

english: while singing the chorus of 'This Ole House'
irish: agus curfá 'This Ole House' a chanadh ag an am céanna

english: a feast or festival, presenting a prize, saying goodbye, going to sleep
irish: féasta nó féile, bronnadh duaise, ag fágáil slán, ag dul a chodladh

english: fire, beauty, earthquakes, machinery
irish: tine, áilleacht, creathanna talún, innealra

english: for a particular occasion
irish: d'ócáid faoi leith

english: to accompany a song, story, poem, riddle, joke, game
irish: chun amhrán, scéal, dán, tomhas, greann nó cluiche a thionlacan

english: to convey mood or atmosphere
irish: chun giúmar nó atmaisféar a chur in iúl

english: to illustrate an abstract concept
irish: chun coincheap teibí a léiriú

english: to illustrate characters or sequences of events
irish: chun pearsana nó sraith eachtraí a léiriú

english: graphic notation 'Volcanoes'
irish: nodaireacht ghrafach ‘Bolcáin’

english: boy soprano (treble), opera singer, rock singer
irish: soprán gasúir (tribil), amhránaí ceoldráma, amhránaí rac-cheoil

english: raspy, throaty, raw, true, pure, clear, thin, rich
irish: grágach, piachánach, neamhoilte, amh, cruinn, glinn, tanaí, saibhir

english: soprano, alto, tenor, bass
irish: soprán, alt, teanór, dord

english: hey! hey! hey!'
irish: 'haigh! haigh! haigh!'

english: nasal sounds, belly laughs, whistling, whispering, muttering, hissing
irish: fuaimeanna srónacha, scairt gháire, feadaíl, cogarnaíl, monabhar, siosarnach

english: short, sharp vocal sounds, spoken and sung
irish: fuaimeanna gearra géara gutha, iad labhartha agus canta

english: slowly descending or ascending singing sounds
irish: fuaimeanna canta agus iad ag teacht anuas nó ag dul suas go mall

english: glockenspiel to represent a dancing clown
irish: glacainspíl chun fear grinn ag damhsa a léiriú

english: keyboard or electronic sounds to represent moon walking
irish: fuaimeanna méarchláir nó leictreonacha chun siúl ar an ngealach a léiriú

english: low notes on a piano to represent caves
irish: nótaí ísle ar an bpianó chun uaimheanna a léiriú

english: shakers to represent hammering rain
irish: croitheadóirí chun clagarnaíl báistí a léiriú

english: violin to represent cats wailing
irish: veidhlín chun cait ag olagón a léiriú

english: wobble board to represent water or waves
irish: clár longadánach chun uisce nó tonnta a léiriú

english: blowing, plucking, striking or shaking in a variety of ways and with a variety of tools
irish: séideadh, stoitheadh, bualadh nó croitheadh ar bhealaí éagsúla agus le huirlisí  eagsúla

english: exploring the inside of a piano, guitar, violin, accordion
irish: an taobh istigh de phianó, ghiotár, veidhlín, chairdín a iniúchadh

english: home-made instruments: shakers, metal or wooden objects, fibres, beads, pipes, comb-and-paper kazoos, wobble boards, drums made with rubber tyre tubing stretched over a tin stringed instruments made with rubber bands stretched over a box shape
irish: uirlisí a rinneadh sa bhaile: croitheadóirí, rudaí adhmaid nó miotail, snáithíní, coirniní, píopa, kazoo círe agus páipéir, crithchláir, drumaí a rinneadh trí thiúb rubair a shíneadh trasna soithigh stáin

english: manufactured untuned percussion instruments: drum, jingle stick, triangle
irish: cnaguirlisí saothraithe neamhthiúnta: druma, clingmhaide, triantán

english: melodic instruments: tin whistle, recorder, guitar, keyboard, violin
irish: uirlisí séiseacha: feadóg stáin, fliúit Shasanach, giotár, méarchlár, veidhlín

english: releasing air slowly out of a balloon
irish: aer a scaoileadh as balún go mall

english: striking or blowing across the top of a bottle partly filled with water, varying the amount
irish: barr buidéal ina bhfuil roinnt uisce a bhualadh nó séideadh thairis, an méid uisce sa bhuidéal a athrú

english: tuned percussion: chime bar, xylophone
irish: cnaguirlisí tiúnta: barra clingíní, xileafón

english: creating more complex sequences involving slapping, clapping, clicking etc. and alternating left and right hands or feet
irish: seichimh níos casta a chruthú le greadadh cos, bualadh bos, smeach méar srl. iontu agus na lámha nó na cosa clé agus deasa in úsáid gach re seach

english: tapping, clapping, slapping, clicking
irish: cnagadh, bualadh bos, greadadh cos, smeach méar

english: echoes
irish: macallaí

english: noise pollution
irish: macallaí

english: resonance
irish: athshondas

english: sound waves
irish: tonnta fuaime

english: vibrating air, string, metal
irish: aer, téad, miotal ar tonnchrith

irish: canta do shiolla amháin (m.sh. da da da)

irish: sos aon-bhuille (sos croisín)

irish: trí bhuille (minim poncaithe)

irish: dhá bhuille (minim)

english: staff notation
irish: cliathnodaireacht

irish: slatnodairecht le hainmneacha sólfá scríofa faoina bun

english: Frère Jacques', 'Codail, a Stóirín'
irish: 'Frère Jacques', 'Codail, a Stóirín'

english: repertoire may include:
irish: sa stór ceoil bheadh

english: Shepherd's Song' from the Pastoral Symphony by Beethoven
irish: 'Amhrán an Aoire' as Siansa Uimhir 6 le Beethoven

english: simple melodies of familiar songs learned in previous years
irish: séiseanna simplí amhrán coitianta a foghlaimíodh sna blianta roimhe sin

english: simple rounds
irish: rothlaim shimplí

english: tin whistle, recorder, keyboard
irish: feadóg stáin, fliúit Shasanach, méarchlár

english: tuned percussion instruments (e.g. chime bars, glockenspiel, xylophone)
irish: cnaguirlisí tiúnta (m.sh. barraí clingíní, glockenspiel, xileafón)

english: tunes from the listening programme
irish: foinn as an gclár éisteachta

english: flicking, rolling, slapping or shaking a cabasa
irish: cabasa a smeachadh, a rolladh, a ghreadadh nó a chroitheadh

english: playing a xylophone with one or two sticks
irish: xileafón a sheinm le bata amháin nó le dhá bhata

english: using various features on an electronic keyboard
irish: gnéithe éagsúla a úsáid ar mhéarchlár leictreonach

english: playing a rhythmic ostinato (a pattern that is repeated over and over) or a drone (long, held note or notes) to accompany familiar tunes and songs
irish: ostinato (patrún athdhéanta arís agus arís eile) rithimeach nó dordán (nóta nó nótaí fada marthanacha) mar thionlacan d'fhoinn agus d'amhráin choitianta

english: in groups: the children begin walking as their singing part begins and stop, in turn, as it finishes
irish: i ngrúpaí: tosaíonn na páistí ag siúl nuair a thosaíonn an pháirt atá le canadh acu agus stopann siad, ar uainíocht, nuair a chríochnaíonn sí

english: singing in unison 'Row Your Boat': the children walk in a circle, keeping time to the music
irish: 'Row Your Boat' a chanadh in aoncheol: siúlann na páistí i gciorcal, ag coinneáil ama leis an gceol

english: identify the direction of the melody in notation
irish: treo na séise a aithint sa nodaireacht

english: recognise similar and contrasting melody patterns: AB form or ABA form, AB: 'Greensleeves', 'Tá na Báid', ABA: 'A Shaighdiúrí­n, a Chroí ', 'Cnocáinín Aerach Chill Mhuire'
irish: patrúin shéiseacha atá cosúil lena chéile nó i gcodarsnacht a aithint: foirm AB nó foirm ABA, AB: 'Tá na Báid', 'Greensleeves', ABA: 'Cnocáinín Aerach Chill Mhuire', 'A Shaighdiúirín, a Chroí'

english: state whether the tones of a melody move by steps, by leaps, or by repeats
irish: a rá cé acu an bhfuil toin séise ag gluaiseacht i gcéimeanna, de léimeanna nó trí athdhéanamh

english: add-on songs: 'Twelve Days of Christmas', 'Hole in the Bottom of the Sea'
irish: amhráin le haguisíní : 'Twelve Days of Christmas', 'Hole in the Bottom of the Sea'

english: verse and refrain, call-and-response, solo-chorus, question-and-answer
irish: véarsa agus loinneog, glaoch agus freagairt, aonréad-cór, ceist agus freagra

irish: na focail a fhuaimniú go soiléir le gutaí leathana agus consain bheoga shoiléire

irish: cruthú luaile a thástáil i dteannta le páirtí agus i ngrúpaí beaga

english: AB (where A represents the first section and B a second, contrasting section but both have a 'common thread'): binary form
irish: AB (áit a seasann A don chéad chuid agus B don dara cuid, atá codarsnach le A ach 'an fhéith chéanna' a bheith ag rith tríothu araon): foirm dhénártha

english: ABA (as above but returning to A): ternary form
irish: ABA (mar atá thuas, ach filleadh ar A): foirm thrénártha

english: narrative: unfolding a story or idea (March to Kinsale)
irish: insint: scéal nó idé á nochtadh (Máirseáil go Cionn tSáile)

english: copying and contrasting
irish: aithris agus codarsnacht

english: following and imitating
irish: leanúint agus aithris

english: meeting and parting
irish: bualadh le chéile agus scaradh

english: (La Vinca) Italian folk dance, French peasant dance
irish: La Vinca (damhsa tíre Iodálach), damhsa tíre Francach

english: two-hand reel, Haymaker's Jig, Rakes of Mallow, Staicín Eorna, a local set dance
irish: cor beirte, Baint an Fhéir, Réicí Mhala, Staicín Eorna, seit áitiúil

english: identifying moments when unison and canon occur
irish: na móimintí a tharlaíonn comhréir agus canóin a aithint

english: identifying sections of a dance in binary form
irish: codanna de dhamhsa a bhfuil foirm dhénártha orthu a aithint

english: commenting on the originality of the dance
irish: leithleachas an damhsa a phlé

english: examining the origins of folk dance and the role that dance plays in different cultures and traditions
irish: bunús an damhsa tíre a iniúchadh maille leis an bpáirt a ghlacann an damhsa i gcultúir agus i dtraidisiúin dhifriúla

english: examining the use of movement to communicate meaning and mood
irish: úsáid na luaile chun brí agus meon a chur i gcéill a scrúdú

english: examining the use of props or costumes
irish: úsáid culaithirtí nó fearais a scrúdú

english: identifying the compositional techniques used
irish: na teicníochtaí cumadóireachta a úsáideadh a aithint

english: identifying the structure and form of a dance
irish: struchtúr agus foirm an damhsa a aithint

english: selecting music or other forms of accompaniment
irish: ceol agus cineálacha eile tionlacain a roghnú

irish: cluichí mion-eitpheile 3 v. 3

irish: mionchluichí corr 5 v. 5 nó cruicéad 6 v. 6 (mearchruicéad)

irish: mionchluichí cispheile agus líonpheile

english: moving to receive a ball
irish: bogadh d'fhonn liathróid a ghlacadh

english: using a chest pass, overhead pass, bounce pass, spin pass, pop pass or sweep pass where appropriate

irish: liathróid a phéacardú le camán

irish: liathróid atá faoi shiúl a bhualadh le camán

irish: liathróid a smiotadh chuig páirtí

english: controlling a ball in the air with inside of the foot
irish: liathróid a rialú san aer leis an taobh istigh den chos

irish: liathróid a ghibreacht agus an chonair a athrú trí bheith ag iompú agus ag casadh

irish: liathróid a dhropchiceáil

english: undertaking a journey where some of the objects marked on the plan are the same (e.g. three benches or three trees, distinguished only by their orientation or position on the site)
irish: tabhairt faoi thuras nuair is ionann roinnt de na nithe atá marcáilte ar an bplean (m.sh. trí bhinse nó trí chrann, agus gan d'idirdhealú orthu ach a dtreoshuíomh nó a n-ionad sa chlós)

english: checking a map at base, working out how to find the control, then leaving the map behind while visiting the control
irish: léarscáil ag an mbunáit a imscrúdú, conas teacht ar an ionad rialaithe a bheartú, an léarscáil a fhágáil ar leataobh ansin agus dul go dtí an t-ionad rialaithe

english: visiting all controls in order, marking a control card or collecting permanent information at each control (e.g. how many steps are there at the door?)
irish: cuairt a thabhairt ar na hionaid rialaithe go léir in ord, cárta rialaithe a mharcáil nó buaneolas a bhailiú ag gach ionad acu (m.sh. an mó céim atá ag an doras?)

english: working in groups within a time limit, visiting all the controls; the various controls are given different 'score' values
irish: cuairt a thabhairt ar na hionaid rialaithe go léir i ngrúpaí laistigh de theorainn ama; bronntar 'scóir' dhifriúla ar na hionaid éagsúla

english: using an obstacle course made more challenging by being asked to carry a plastic cup of water from start to finish or by being led blindfolded by a partner
irish: bac-chúrsa a úsáid -- é a bheith níos dúshlánaí toisc dualgas a bheith ar an iomaitheoir cupán plaisteach lán d'uisce a iompar ó thús deireadh nó ligean do pháirtí é/í a threorú agus dallóg ar a s(h)úile

english: using raised obstacles of varying heights and sizes to cross an imaginary river with help from a partner (stepping-stones)
irish: bacainní ardaithe, iad éagsúil maidir le hairde agus méid, a úsáid d'fhonn abhainn shamhailteach a thrasnú le cabhair ó pháirtí (clochán)

english: (*Note: activities usually available at outdoor centres or specially equipped gymnasiums)
irish: *gníomhaíochtaí iad seo a bhíonn ar fáil de ghnáth in ionaid d'imeachtaí lasmuigh nó i hallaí gleacaíochta a mbíonn sainfheisteas iontu

english: climbing wall bars, using three points of contact*
irish: barraí balla a dhreapadh agus trí phointe tadhaill a úsáid*

irish: rópaí cuí a thrasnú agus na lámha agus na cosa a bheith á n-úsáid*

irish: n gá atá leis an imshaol a chaomhnú a léirthuiscint

english: caring for living things
irish: aire a thabhairt do dhúile beo

english: disposing of litter appropriately
irish: dramhaíl a chur i leataobh sa chaoi cheart

english: identifying appropriate safety measures when engaged in activities outside the school site
irish: beartais sábháilteachta cuí a d'fhónfadh do ghníomhaíochtaí lasmuigh de chlós na scoile a aithint

english: discussing how other individuals or groups completed their challenges
irish: mar a gcomhallann daoine nó grúpaí eile a ndúshláin a phlé

english: planning to collect controls in a group orienteering activity
irish: bailiú rialaitheoirí nuair a bhíonn grúpghníomhaíocht treodóireachta ar siúl a phleanáil

english: understand and apply cycling safety skills
irish: scileanna sábháilteachta rothaíochta a thuiscint agus a chur i bhfeidhm

english: undertake a journey by bicycle where appropriate
irish: páistí a threorú feadh cosán marcáilte san fhoraois, tascanna oiriúnacha a bheith le comhlíonadh feadh an bhealaigh (m.sh. cuimilteán de choirt a dhéanamh ag ionad cuí)

english: examining the design and construction of shelters from natural or improvised materials
irish: dearadh agus déanamh scáthlán a thógfaí le hábhair aiceanta nó le hábhair sheiftithe a imscrúdú

english: pitching a tent
irish: campa a shuíomh

english: undertaking a camping trip to a suitable location
irish: tabhairt faoi thuras campála go dtí ionad oiriúnach

english: using camping stoves
irish: soirn champála a úsáid

english: exploring forest and hill walks with appropriate tasks to be undertaken along the route (e.g. using a compass at the first junction, note the direction walked when on the right-hand path)
irish: siúlóidí foraoise agus cnoic a iniúchadh agus tascanna cuí a bheith le déanamh feadh an bhealaigh (m.sh. casadh faoi dheis ag an gcéad chrosaire agus compás a úsáid chun an treo siúlóide a aimsiú)

english: using a local pool or adventure centre
irish: linn nó lárionad eachtraíochta áitiúil a úsáid

english: undertaking a journey where some of the objects marked on the plan are the same (e.g. three benches or three trees, distinguished only by their orientation or position on the site)
irish: tabhairt faoi thuras nuair is ionann roinnt de na nithe atá marcáilte ar an bplean (m.sh. trí bhinse nó trí chrann, agus gan d'idirdhealú orthu ach a dtreoshuíomh nó a n-ionad sa chlós)

english: checking a map at base, working out how to find the control, then leaving the map behind while visiting the control
irish: léarscáil ag an mbunáit a imscrúdú, conas teacht ar an ionad rialaithe a bheartú, an léarscáil a fhágáil ar leataobh ansin agus dul go dtí an t-ionad rialaithe

english: visiting all controls in order, marking a control card or collecting permanent information at each control (e.g. how many steps are there at the door?)
irish: cuairt a thabhairt ar na hionaid rialaithe go léir in ord, cárta rialaithe a mharcáil nó buaneolas a bhailiú ag gach ionad acu (m.sh. an mó céim atá ag an doras?)

english: working in groups within a time limit, visiting all the controls; the various controls are given different 'score' values
irish: cuairt a thabhairt ar na hionaid rialaithe go léir i ngrúpaí laistigh de theorainn ama; bronntar 'scóir' dhifriúla ar na hionaid éagsúla

english: using an obstacle course made more challenging by being asked to carry a plastic cup of water from start to finish or by being led blindfolded by a partner
irish: bac-chúrsa a úsáid -- é a bheith níos dúshlánaí toisc dualgas a bheith ar an iomaitheoir cupán plaisteach lán d'uisce a iompar ó thús deireadh nó ligean do pháirtí é/í a threorú agus dallóg ar a s(h)úile

english: using raised obstacles of varying heights and sizes to cross an imaginary river with help from a partner (stepping-stones)
irish: bacainní ardaithe, iad éagsúil maidir le hairde agus méid, a úsáid d'fhonn abhainn shamhailteach a thrasnú le cabhair ó pháirtí (clochán)

english: (*Note: activities usually available at outdoor centres or specially equipped gymnasiums)
irish: *gníomhaíochtaí iad seo a bhíonn ar fáil de ghnáth in ionaid d'imeachtaí lasmuigh nó i hallaí gleacaíochta a mbíonn sainfheisteas iontu

english: climbing wall bars, using three points of contact*
irish: barraí balla a dhreapadh agus trí phointe tadhaill a úsáid*

english: crossing appropriate ropes using hands and feet*
irish: rópaí cuí a thrasnú agus na lámha agus na cosa a bheith á n-úsáid*

irish: n gá atá leis an imshaol a chaomhnú a léirthuiscint

irish: aire a thabhairt do dhúile beo

irish: dramhaíl a chur i leataobh sa chaoi cheart

irish: beartais sábháilteachta cuí a d'fhónfadh do ghníomhaíochtaí lasmuigh de chlós na scoile a aithint

english: discussing how other individuals or groups completed their challenges
irish: mar a gcomhallann daoine nó grúpaí eile a ndúshláin a phlé

english: planning to collect controls in a group orienteering activity
irish: bailiú rialaitheoirí nuair a bhíonn grúpghníomhaíocht treodóireachta ar siúl a phleanáil

irish: scileanna sábháilteachta rothaíochta a thuiscint agus a chur i bhfeidhm

irish: páistí a threorú feadh cosán marcáilte san fhoraois, tascanna oiriúnacha a bheith le comhlíonadh feadh an bhealaigh (m.sh. cuimilteán de choirt a dhéanamh ag ionad cuí)

irish: dearadh agus déanamh scáthlán a thógfaí le hábhair aiceanta nó le hábhair sheiftithe a imscrúdú

irish: campa a shuíomh

irish: tabhairt faoi thuras campála go dtí ionad oiriúnach

irish: soirn champála a úsáid

irish: siúlóidí foraoise agus cnoic a iniúchadh agus tascanna cuí a bheith le déanamh feadh an bhealaigh (m.sh. casadh faoi dheis ag an gcéad chrosaire agus compás a úsáid chun an treo siúlóide a aimsiú)

irish: linn nó lárionad eachtraíochta áitiúil a úsáid

irish: ag déanamh gearán agus ag lorg cúitimh, ag forbairt a (h)achar spéise féin agus bheith muiníneach as a b(h)reithiúnais féin, bheith eolach ar a c(h)earta agus iad a bhaint amach

english: recognising where he/she is successful, realising that making and acknowledging mistakes can provide opportunities for learning
irish: a aithint cathain a éiríonn leis/léi, a thuiscint gur féidir le botúin a dhéantar agus admhaítear deiseanna le haghaidh foghlama a chur ar fáil

english: taking initiative, organising, planning, displaying or executing a project independently or as part of a group, reflecting on ways to improve learning on own achievements
irish: bheith tionscnach, ag eagrú, ag pleanáil, ag léiriú nó ag cur tionscadail i bhfeidhm go neamhspleách nó mar bhall de ghrúpa, ag machnamh ar shlite chun foghlaim a fheabhsú maidir lena g(h)nóthachtáil féin

english: through the clothes we wear, interests and activities pursued, life-style, beliefs, personal attitudes and principles held
irish: trí na héadaí a chaithimid, na hachair spéise agus na gníomhaíochtaí a chleachtar, stíl mhaireachtála, na creidimh an dearcadh agus na prionsabail phearsanta a bhíonn againn

english: being part of a savings scheme, caring for own belongings, taking responsibility for his/her homework
irish: bheith páirteach i scéim choigiltis ag tabhairt aire dá s(h)ealús féin, ag glacadh le freagracht as a (h)obair bhaile féin

english: air, body fluids, direct contact, poor hygiene and sanitation
irish: an t-aer, leachtanna coirp, teagmháil dhíreach, drochshláinteachas agus drochshláintíocht

english: chickenpox, rubella, HIV infection, hepatitis
irish: deilgneach, bruitíneach dhearg, ionfhabhtú VEID, heipitíteas

english: infections are spread through:
irish: scaiptear ionfhabhtú trí:

english: some communicable diseases:
irish: roinnt galar tógálach

english: using before sell-by date, reading contents, not chopping cooked foods and uncooked foods on the same board
irish: é a úsáid roimh spriocdháta díola, a bhfuil ann a léamh, gan bianna bruite agus neamhbhruite a mhionghearradh ar an gclár céanna

english: alcohol, nicotine, prescribed and non-prescribed substances, cannabis
irish: alcól, nicitín, substaintí a bhíonn/nach mbíonn ar oideas, cannnabis

irish: céiliach, diaibéiteach, anoireicse, búilime, na riachtanais dhifriúla bhia de chuid aoisghrúpaí agus daoine difriúla

english: peer pressure, influence of advertising, to feel good, to impress others, to make one feel grown up
irish: brú ó phiaraí, tionchar na fógraíochta, chun brath go maith, chun dul i gcion ar dhaoine eile, chun go mbraithfeadh duine go bhfuil sé/sí fásta suas

irish: costas, fógraíocht, éileamh, brú piaraí, fógraíocht agus pacáistiú, luach do chuid airgid, am le haghaidh siopadóireachta agus cócaireachta, corpíomhánna idéalacha

english: danger of experimentation leading to addiction
irish: baol na tástála a chothaíonn andúil

irish: orgáin sheachtracha, an tsrón, an craiceann

irish: tosca na stíle maireachtála: réim bia, sláinteachas, scíth

irish: baineann: athruithe hormónacha, athrú ar chruth an choirp, forbairt na gcíoch, caithir ag fás, tús le míostrú

english: male:  hormonal changes, physical growth, enlargement of testicles and penis, appearance of pubic, underarm and facial hair, breaking of the voice, beginning of sperm production, onset of nocturnal emissions (wet dreams)
irish: fireann: athruithe hormónacha, fás fisiceach, méadú ar na magairlí agus ar an mbod, teacht caithre, agus gruaige faoin ascaill agus ar an aghaidh, briseadh gutha, tús le táirgeadh speirme, tús le sceitheadh oíche (taibhrimh fhliucha)

explore the concept of division of decimals with concrete materials, money and measurement

irish: an uimhirlíne a shiúl chun cleachtadh a fháil ar uimhreacha deimhneacha agus diúltacha a éiríonn le linn díospóireachta nó i gcomhthéacs, uimhreacha deimhneacha is diúltacha a aithint agus a mharcáil ar uimhirlínte pearsanta nó ranga

irish: Ghearr Peadar píosa ribín ina chúig chuid chothroma. Bhí gach cuid 30 cm ar fhad. Cá fhad a bhí sa ribín sular gearradh é?

irish: rialacha a dhéaduchtú agus a chlárú i gcás patrúin uimhreacha luaite

irish: 1 cheann/1 eireaball 52

english: 2 heads            20
irish: 2 cheann 20

english: 2 tails               28
irish: 2 eireaball 28

english: discuss, is this what we expected?
irish: na torthaí a phlé; an é sin a cheapamar roimh ré?

english: outcome      frequency
irish: toradh minicíocht

english: perform the experiment (toss two coins, draw a cube from a bag containing a number of different-coloured cubes) a large number of times; larger numbers of throws can be achieved by using group work
irish: an triail (dhá bhonn a chaitheamh; ciúb a bhaint as mála ina bhfuil líon de chiúbanna le dathana difriúla) a dhéanamh go minic; is féidir líon níos mó trialacha a aimsiú trí oibriú i ngrúpaí

english: pupils are given a bag and told it contains 10 cubes in 3 different colours; by drawing a cube repeatedly, say 50 times, and constructing a frequency table, they must estimate how many cubes of each colour there are in the bag
irish: tugtar mála do na páistí agus deirtear leo go bhfuil deich gciúb ann de trí dhath dhifriúla; pioctar ciúb amach go leantach, 50 uaire b'fhéidir, agus cuirtear tábla minicíochta le chéile; iarrtar ar na páistí a mheas cá mhéad ciúb de gach dath atá sa mhál

english: record the outcomes and use to construct a frequency table; for example, when tossing two coins, the table might look as follows:
irish: na torthaí a chlárú agus a úsáid chun tábla minicíochta a chur le chéile; mar shampla, dá gcaithfí dhá bhonn in airde bheadh an dealramh seo ar an tábla, b'fhéidir:

english: using two coins of different colours may help examine a table of school attendance for the class what is the chance of full attendance on any one day?
irish: ba chabhair é dhá bhonn le dathanna difriúla a úsáid tábla de thinreamh scoile don rang a scrúdú - cad é an seans lántinreamh a bheith ann lá áirithe?

english: we estimate the chance of 2 heads to be 20/100, that of 2 tails to be 28/100, that of one head and one tail to be 52/100:
irish: áirímid seans de 20/100 a bheith ann go roghnófaí dhá cheann, 28/100 go roghnófaí dhá eireaball, agus 52/100 go roghnófaí ceann agus eireaball:

english: what is the chance of more than 20% of the class being absent on any one day?
irish: cad é an seans neamhláithreacht de bhreis ar 20% den rang a bheith ann ar aon lá faoi leith?

english: what if the bag contains 5 red, 5 blue and 5 green cubes? or 3 red, 6 blue and 6 green?
irish: Conas a bheadh le cúig chiúb dhearga, cúig chiúb ghorma agus cúig chiúb uaine sa mhála? nó trí chiúb dhearga, sé chiúb ghorma, agus sé chiúb uaine?

english: when drawing a cube from a bag containing 3 red and 6 blue cubes, a blue cube has 6 chances in 9 of occurring and thus has a probability of 6-9 or 2-3 ; the probability of drawing a red cube is 3/9 or 1/3
irish: Nuair a thógtar ciúb as mála ina bhfuil trí chiúb dhearga agus sé chiúb ghorma tá sé sheans as naoi ann gur ciúb gorm a phiocfar, is é sin seans de 6/9 nó 2/3; is é sheans go bpiocfar ciúb dearg ná 3/9 nó 1/3

english: when rolling a die, each outcome has a 1 in 6 chance of occurring -- therefore the likelihood is 1/6
irish: Agus dísle á rolladh, bíonn seans de 1 as 6 ag gach toradh tarlú -- mar sin tá an seans cothrom le 1/6

english: when tossing a coin, a head has 1 chance in 2 of occurring; thus the  ikelihood of a head is 1 in 2, or 1-2 or 50%, similarly for a tail
irish: nuair a chaitear bonn in airde tá seans de 1 as 2 nó 1/2 nó 50% ag an gceann a bheith in uachtar; mar an gcéanna don eireaball

english: discuss and list all possible outcomes of:
irish: na torthaí go léir ab fhéidir a bheith ar na próisis seo a leanas a phlé agus a liostú:

english: rolling two dice and calculating the total
irish: dhá dhísle a rolladh agus an t-iomlán a ríomh (2, 3, 4 ... 12)

english: selecting two numbers at random from the numbers 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 (ten possibilities)
irish: dhá uimhir a roghnú go fánach as na huimhreacha 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 (deich bhféidearthacht)

irish: dhá dhísle a rolladh agus an t-iomlán a ríomh (2, 3, 4 ... 12)

irish: na torthaí a chur in iúl mar chodáin nó mar dheachúlacha d'aonaid mhéadracha chuí
